data.prerequisites: Dex 15, Two-Weapon Fighting.
data.description: You are skilled at defending yourself while dual-wielding.
data.benefit: When wielding a double weapon or two weapons (not including natural weapons or unarmed strikes), you gain a +1 shield bonus to your AC. When you are fighting defensively or using the total defense action, this shield bonus increases to +2.

data.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
data.prerequisites: Dex 15.
data.description: You can fight with a weapon wielded in each of your hands. You can make one extra attack each round with the secondary weapon.
data.benefit: Your penalties on attack rolls for fighting with two weapons are reduced. The penalty for your primary hand lessens by 2 and the one for your off hand lessens by 6. See Two-Weapon Fighting in Chapter 8.
data.normal: If you wield a second weapon in your off hand, you can get one extra attack per round with that weapon. When fighting in this way you suffer a -6 penalty with your regular attack or attacks with your primary hand and a -10 penalty to the attack with your off hand. If your offhand weapon is light, the penalties are reduced by 2 each. An unarmed strike is always considered light.

data.name: Two-Weapon Rend
data.prerequisites: Dex 17, Double Slice, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +11.
data.description: Striking with both of your weapons simultaneously, you can use them to deliver devastating wounds.
data.benefit: If you hit an opponent with both your primary hand and your off-hand weapon, you deal an additional 1d10 points of damage plus 1-1/2 times your Strength modifier. You can only deal this additional damage once each round.

data.name: Unseat
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Ride 1 rank, Mounted Combat, Power Attack, Improved Bull Rush, base attack bonus +1.
data.description: You are skilled at unseating your mounted opponents.
data.benefit: When charging an opponent while mounted and wielding a lance, resolve the attack as normal. If it hits, you may immediately make a free bull rush attempt in addition to the normal damage. If successful, the target is knocked off his horse and lands prone in a space adjacent to his mount that is directly away from you.

data.name: Vital Strike
data.prerequisites: Base attack bonus +6.
data.description: You make a single attack that deals significantly more damage than normal.
data.benefit: When you use the attack action, you can make one attack at your highest base attack bonus that deals additional damage. Roll the weapon's damage dice for the attack twice and add the results together before adding bonuses from Strength, weapon abilities (such as flaming), precision-based damage, and other damage bonuses. These extra weapon damage dice are not multiplied on a critical hit, but are added to the total.

data.name: Weapon Finesse
data.description: You are trained in using your agility in melee combat, as opposed to brute strength.
data.benefit: With a light weapon, elven curve blade, rapier, whip, or spiked chain made for a creature of your size category, you may use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls. If you carry a shield, its armor check penalty applies to your attack rolls.
data.special: Natural weapons are considered light weapons.

data.name: Weapon Focus
data.prerequisites: Proficiency with selected weapon, base attack bonus +1.
data.description: Choose one type of weapon. You can also choose unarmed strike or grapple (or ray, if you are a spellcaster) as your weapon for the purposes of this feat.
data.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on all attack rolls you make using the selected weapon.
data.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

data.name: Weapon Specialization
data.prerequisites: Proficiency with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, fighter level 4th.
data.description: You are skilled at dealing damage with one weapon. Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you have already selected the Weapon Focus feat. You deal extra damage when using this weapon.
data.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon.
data.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

data.name: Whirlwind Attack
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Int 13, Combat Expertise, Dodge, Mobility, Spring Attack, base attack bonus +4.
data.description: You can strike out at every foe within reach.
data.benefit: When you use the full-attack action, you can give up your regular attacks and instead make one melee attack at your highest base attack bonus against each opponent within reach. You must make a separate attack roll against each opponent. When you use the Whirlwind Attack feat, you also forfeit any bonus or extra attacks granted by other feats, spells, or abilities.

data.name: Widen Spell
data.description: You can cast your spells so that they occupy a larger space.
data.benefit: You can alter a burst, emanation, or spread-shaped spell to increase its area. Any numeric measurements of the spell's area increase by 100%. A widened spell uses up a spell slot three levels higher than the spell's actual level. Spells that do not have an area of one of these four sorts are not affected by this feat.

data.name: Wind Stance
data.prerequisites: Dex 15, Dodge, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: Your erratic movements make it difficult for enemies to pinpoint your location.
data.benefit: If you move more than 5 feet this turn, you gain 20% concealment for 1 round against ranged attacks.

data.name: Additional Traits
data.description: You have more traits than normal.
data.benefit: You gain two character traits of your choice (see Chapter 8). These traits must be chosen from different lists, and cannot be chosen from lists from which you have already selected a character trait. You must meet any additional qualifications for the character traits you choose.

data.name: Ability Focus
data.prerequisites: Special attack.
data.description: One of this creature's special attacks is particularly difficult to resist.
data.benefit: Choose one of the creature's special attacks. Add +2 to the DC for all saving throws against the special attack on which the creature focuses.
data.special: A creature can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time the creature takes the feat, it applies to a different special attack.

data.name: Awesome Blow
data.prerequisites: Str 25, Power Attack, Improved Bull Rush, size Large or larger.
data.description: This creature can send opponents flying.
data.benefit: As a standard action, the creature may perform an awesome blow combat maneuver. If the creature's maneuver succeeds against a corporeal opponent smaller than itself, its opponent takes damage (typically slam damage plus Strength bonus) and is knocked flying 10 feet in a direction of the attacking creature's choice and falls prone. The attacking creature can only push the opponent in a straight line, and the opponent can't move closer to the attacking creature than the square it started in. If an obstacle prevents the completion of the opponent's move, the opponent and the obstacle each take 1d6 points of damage, and the opponent is knocked prone in the space adjacent to the obstacle.

data.name: Craft Construct
data.prerequisites: Caster level 5th, Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Wondrous Item.
data.description: You can create construct creatures like golems.
data.benefit: You can create any construct whose prerequisites you meet. The act of animating a construct takes one day for each 1,000 gp in its market price. To create a construct, you must use up raw materials costing half of its base price, plus the full cost of the basic body created for the construct. Each construct has a special section that summarizes its costs and other prerequisites. A newly created construct has average hit points for its Hit Dice.

data.name: Empower Spell-Like Ability
data.prerequisites: Spell-like ability at caster level 6th or higher.
data.description: One of this creature's spell-like abilities is particularly potent and powerful.
data.benefit: Choose one of the creature's spell-like abilities, subject to the restrictions below. The creature can use that ability as an empowered spell-like ability three times per day (or less, if the ability is normally usable only once or twice per day). When a creature uses an empowered spell-like ability, all variable, numeric effects of the spell-like ability are increased by half (+50%). Saving throws and opposed rolls are not affected. Spell-like abilities without random variables are not affected. The creature can only select a spell-like ability duplicating a spell with a level less than or equal to 1/2 its caster level (round down) - 2. For a summary, see the table in the description of the Quicken Spell-Like Ability feat on page 316.
data.special: This feat can be taken multiple times. Each time it is taken, the creature can apply it to a different spell-like ability.

data.name: Flyby Attack
data.prerequisites: Fly speed.
data.description: This creature can make an attack before and after it moves while flying.
data.benefit: When flying, the creature can take a move action and another standard action at any point during the move. The creature cannot take a second move action during a round when it makes a flyby attack.
data.normal: Without this feat, the creature takes a standard action either before or after its move.

data.name: Hover
data.prerequisites: Fly speed.
data.description: This creature can hover in place with ease and can kick up clouds of dust and debris.
data.benefit: A creature with this feat can halt its movement while flying, allowing it to hover without needing to make a Fly skill check. If a creature of size Large or larger with this feat hovers within 20 feet of the ground in an area with lots of loose debris, the draft from its wings creates a hemispherical cloud with a radius of 60 feet. The winds generated can snuff torches, small campfires, exposed lanterns, and other small, open flames of non-magical origin. Clear vision within the cloud is limited to 10 feet. Creatures have concealment at 15 to 20 feet (20% miss chance). At 25 feet or more, creatures have total concealment (50% miss chance, and opponents cannot use sight to locate the creature).
data.normal: Without this feat, a creature must make a Fly skill check to hover and the creature does not create a cloud of debris while hovering.

data.name: Improved Natural Armor
data.prerequisites: Natural armor, Con 13.
data.description: This creature's hide is tougher than most.
data.benefit: The creature's natural armor bonus increases by +1.
data.special: A creature can gain this feat multiple times. Each time the creature takes the feat, its natural armor bonus increases by another point.

data.name: Improved Natural Attack
data.prerequisites: Natural weapon, base attack bonus +4.
data.description: Attacks made by one of this creature's natural attacks leave vicious wounds.
data.benefit: Choose one of the creature's natural attack forms (not an unarmed strike). The damage for this natural attack increases by one step on the following list, as if the creature's size had increased by one category. Damage dice increase as follows: 1d2, 1d3, 1d4, 1d6, 1d8, 2d6, 3d6, 4d6, 6d6, 8d6, 12d6. A weapon or attack that deals 1d10 points of damage increases as follows: 1d10, 2d8, 3d8, 4d8, 6d8, 8d8, 12d8.
data.special: This feat can be taken multiple times. Each time it is taken, it applies to a different natural attack.

data.name: Multiattack
data.prerequisites: Three or more natural attacks.
data.description: This creature is particularly skilled at making attacks with its natural weapons.
data.benefit: The creature's secondary attacks with natural weapons take only a -2 penalty.
data.normal: Without this feat, the creature's secondary attacks with natural weapons take a -5 penalty.

data.name: Quicken Spell-Like Ability
data.prerequisites: Spell-like ability at CL 10th or higher.
data.description: This creature can use one of its spell-like abilities with next to no effort.
data.benefit: Choose one of the creature's spell-like abilities, subject to the restrictions described in this feat. The creature can use the chosen spell-like ability as a quickened spell-like ability three times per day (or less, if the ability is normally usable only once or twice per day). Using a quickened spell-like ability is a swift action that does not provoke an attack of opportunity. The creature can perform another action-including the use of another spell-like ability (but not another swift action)-in the same round that it uses a quickened spell-like ability. The creature may use only one quickened spell-like ability per round. The creature can only select a spell-like ability duplicating a spell with a level less than or equal to 1/2 its caster level (round down) - 4. For a summary, see the table on page 316. A spell-like ability that duplicates a spell with a casting time greater than 1 full round cannot be quickened.
data.normal: The use of a spell-like ability normally requires a standard action (at the very least) and provokes an attack of opportunity.

data.name: Snatch
data.prerequisites: Size Huge or larger.
data.description: This creature can grab other creatures with ease.
data.benefit: The creature can start a grapple when it hits with a claw or bite attack, as though it had the grab ability. If it grapples a creature three or more sizes smaller, it squeezes each round for automatic bite or claw damage with a successful grapple check. A snatched opponent held in the creature's mouth is not allowed a Reflex save against the creature's breath weapon, if it has one. The creature can drop a creature it has snatched as a free action or use a standard action to fling it aside. A f lung creature travels 1d6 X 10 feet, and takes 1d6 points of damage per 10 feet traveled. If the creature flings a snatched opponent while flying, the opponent takes this amount or falling damage, whichever is greater.

data.name: Wingover
data.prerequisites: Fly speed.
data.description: This creature can make turns with ease while flying.
data.benefit: Once each round, a creature with this feat can turn up to 180 degrees as a free action without making a Fly skill check. This free turn does not consume any additional movement from the creature.
data.normal: A flying creature can turn up to 90 degrees by making a DC 15 Fly skill check and expending 5 feet of movement. A flying creature can turn up to 180 degrees by making a DC 20 Fly skill check and expending 10 feet of movement.

data.name: Allied Spellcaster
data.prerequisites: Caster level 1st.
data.description: With the aid of an ally, you are skilled at piercing the protections of other creatures with your spells.
data.benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, you receive a +2 competence bonus on level checks made to overcome spell resistance. If your ally has the same spell prepared (or known with a slot available if they are spontaneous spellcasters), this bonus increases to +4 and you receive a +1 bonus to the caster level for all leveldependent variables, such as duration, range, and effect.

data.name: Arcane Blast
data.prerequisites: Arcane spellcaster, caster level 10th.
data.description: You can convert any spell into an attack.
data.benefit: As a standard action, you can sacrifice a prepared spell or unused spell slot of 1st level or higher and transform it into a ray, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged touch attack. This attack deals 2d6 points of damage plus an additional 1d6 points of damage for every level of the spell or spell slot you sacrificed. 0-level spells may not be sacrificed in this manner.

data.name: Arcane Shield
data.prerequisites: Arcane spellcaster, caster level 10th.
data.description: You can convert any spell into a defense.
data.benefit: As a immediate action, you can sacrifice a prepared spell or unused spell slot of 1st level or higher and gain a def lection bonus to AC equal to the level of the spell or spell slot you sacrificed for 1 round. 0-level spells may not be sacrificed in this manner.

data.name: Arcane Talent
data.prerequisites: Cha 10; elf, half-elf, or gnome.
data.description: Magic is in your blood, and at your fingertips.
data.benefit: Choose a 0-level spell from the sorcerer/wizard spell list. You can cast this spell three times per day as a spell-like ability. The caster level is equal to your character level. The save DC is 10 + your Charisma modifier.

data.name: Aspect of the Beast
data.prerequisites: wild shape class feature, see Special.
data.description: Whether by magic or a curse of your blood, some part of you is more beast than man.
data.benefit: Your bestial nature manifests itself in one of the following ways. You choose the manifestation when you choose the feat, and then you cannot change it. Night Senses (Ex): If your base race has normal vision, you gain low-light vision. If your base race has low-light vision, you gain darkvision out to a range of 30 feet. If your base race has darkvision, the range of your darkvision increases by 30 feet. Claws of the Beast (Ex): You grow a pair of claws. These claws are primary attacks that deal 1d4 points of damage (1d3 if you are Small). Predator's Leap (Ex): You can make a running jump without needing to run 10 feet before you jump. Wild Instinct (Ex): You gain a +2 bonus on initiative checks and a +2 bonus on Survival skill checks.
data.special: A character that has contracted lycanthropy can take this feat without having to meet the prerequisites. A ranger who selects the natural weapon combat style can take this feat without having to meet the prerequisites (even if he does not select Aspect of the Beast as a bonus feat).

data.name: Bashing Finish
data.prerequisites: Improved Shield Bash, Shield Master, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +11.
data.description: You follow a powerful blow from your weapon with an opportunistic bash from your shield.
data.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee weapon, you can make a shield bash attack against the same target using the same bonus as a free action.

data.name: Bloody Assault
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: Sacrificing accuracy, you can inflict bloody wounds that are slow to heal.
data.benefit: You can choose to take a -5 penalty on all melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to inflict 1d4 points of bleed damage with your weapon melee attacks, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the weapon. A creature continues to take bleed damage every round at the start of its turn. Bleed damage can be stopped by a DC 15 Heal check or through any magical healing. Bleed damage from this feat does not stack with itself. You must choose to use this feat before making the attack roll, and its effects last until your next turn (although the bleeding lasts until healed, as normal).

data.name: Bodyguard
data.prerequisites: Combat Reflexes.
data.description: Your swift strikes ward off enemies attacking nearby allies.
data.benefit: When an adjacent ally is attacked, you may use an attack of opportunity to attempt the aid another action to improve your ally's AC. You may not use the aid another action to improve your ally's attack roll with this attack.
data.normal: Aid another is a standard action.

data.name: Bouncing Spell
data.description: You can direct a failed spell against a different target.
data.benefit: Whenever a bouncing spell targeting a single creature has no effect on its intended target (whether due to spell resistance or a successful saving throw) you may, as a swift action, redirect it to target another eligible creature within range. The redirected spell behaves in all ways as if its new target were the original target for the spell. Spells that affect a target in any way (including a lesser effect from a successful saving throw) may not be redirected in this manner. A bouncing spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

data.name: Breadth of Experience
data.prerequisites: Dwarf, elf, or gnome; 100+ years old.
data.description: Although still young for your kind, you have a lifetime of knowledge and training.
data.benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Knowledge and Profession skill checks, and can make checks with those skills untrained.

data.name: Bull Rush Strike
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Improved Bull Rush, Power Attack, base attack bonus +9.
data.description: Your critical hits can push back your foes.
data.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee attack, you can push your opponent back, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the attack. If your confirmation roll exceeds your opponent's CMD, you may push your opponent back as if from the bull rush combat maneuver. You do not need to move with the target if successful. This does not provoke an attack of opportunity.
data.normal: You must perform a bull rush combat maneuver to bull rush an opponent.
data.special: You can only apply the effects of one of the following feats to a given critical hit: Bull Rush Strike, Disarming Strike, Repositioning Strike, Sundering Strike, or Tripping Strike. You may choose to use this feat after you make your confirmation roll.

data.name: Charge Through
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Improved Overrun, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.
data.description: You can overrun enemies when charging.
data.benefit: When making a charge, you can attempt to overrun one creature in the path of the charge as a free action. If you successfully overrun that creature, you can complete the charge. If the overrun is unsuccessful, the charge ends in the space directly in front of that creature.
data.normal: You must have a clear path toward the target of your charge.

data.name: Childlike
data.prerequisites: Cha 13, halfling.
data.description: Your resemblance to a human child tends to make others trust you, perhaps more than they should.
data.benefit: You can take 10 on Bluff checks to convince others you are telling the truth, so long as your story makes you appear innocent. You gain a +2 bonus on Disguise skill checks to pose as a human child, and ignore the check penalties for disguising yourself as a different race and age category while doing so.

data.name: Cloud Step
data.prerequisites: Spider Step, monk level 12th.
data.description: Your tread is of unearthly lightness.
data.benefit: As a move action, you can air walk (as the spell) up to half your slow fall distance, maximum 50 feet. You must reach a solid, level surface by the end of your turn or you will fall.

data.name: Cockatrice Strike
data.prerequisites: Improved Unarmed Strike, Gorgon's Fist, Medusa's Wrath, base attack bonus +14.
data.description: With a single strike, you transmute flesh to stone.
data.benefit: As a full-round action, you can make a single unarmed strike against a dazed, flat-footed, paralyzed, staggered, stunned, or unconscious foe. If that attack is a critical hit, the target is petrified unless it succeeds on a Fortitude saving throw with a DC of 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wisdom modifier. This is a supernatural polymorph effect.

data.name: Combat Patrol
data.prerequisites: Combat Reflexes, Mobility, base attack bonus +5.
data.description: You range across the battlefield, dealing with threats wherever they arise.
data.benefit: As a full-round action, you may set up a combat patrol, increasing your threatened area by 5 feet for every 5 points of your base attack bonus. Until the beginning of your next turn, you may make attacks of opportunity against any opponent in this threatened area that provokes attacks of opportunity. You may move as part of these attacks, provided your total movement before your next turn does not exceed your speed. Any movement you make provokes attacks of opportunity as normal.

data.name: Cooperative Crafting
data.prerequisites: 1 rank in any Craft skill, any item creation feat.
data.description: Your assistance makes item crafting far more efficient.
data.benefit: You can assist another character in crafting mundane and magical items. You must both possess the relevant Craft skill or item creation feat, but either one of you can fulfill any other prerequisites for crafting the item. You provide a +2 circumstance bonus on any Craft or Spellcraft checks related to making an item, and your assistance doubles the gp value of items that can be crafted each day.

data.name: Coordinated Defense
data.description: You are adept at working with allies to avoid being tripped, grappled, and subjected to other maneuvers.
data.benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, you receive a +2 competence bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense. This bonus increases to +4 if the creature attempting the maneuver is larger than both you and your ally.

data.name: Coordinated Maneuvers
data.description: You are skilled at working with your allies to perform dangerous combat maneuvers.
data.benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, you receive a +2 competence bonus on all combat maneuver checks. This bonus increases to +4 when attempting to break free from a grapple.

data.name: Cosmopolitan
data.description: Living in large, exotic cities has put you in touch with many diverse civilizations, cultures, and races.
data.benefit: You can speak and read two additional languages of your choice. In addition, choose two Intelligence-, Wisdom-, or Charisma-based skills. Those skills always count as class skills for you.

data.name: Covering Defense
data.prerequisites: Shield Focus, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: You are skilled at protecting yourself and your allies with your shield.
data.benefit: When you use the total defense action while using a light, heavy, or tower shield, you can provide a cover bonus to AC against all attacks to an adjacent ally your size or smaller. This cover bonus is equal to your shield's shield bonus and lasts until the beginning of your next turn. Your shield does not provide a cover bonus to Ref lex saves.

data.name: Crippling Critical
data.prerequisites: Critical Focus, base attack bonus +13.
data.description: You are able to maim a target and hinder its movement.
data.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit against an opponent, its speed is halved for 1 minute. A successful Fortitude save reduces this duration to 1d4 rounds. The DC of this save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. Against creatures with multiple types of movement, you must choose which movement type to affect. A flying creature hit by this attack must make a DC 10 Fly check to remain airborne, and has its maneuverability reduced by one step.
data.special: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.

data.name: Crossbow Mastery
data.prerequisites: Dex 15, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Reload, Rapid Shot.
data.description: You can load crossbows with blinding speed and even fire them in melee with little fear of reprisal.
data.benefit: The time required for you to reload any type of crossbow is reduced to a free action, regardless of the type of crossbow used. You can fire a crossbow as many times in a full attack action as you could attack if you were using a bow. Reloading a crossbow for the type of crossbow you chose when you took Rapid Reload no longer provokes attacks of opportunity.
data.special: Starting at 6th level, a ranger with the archery combat style may select Crossbow Mastery as a combat style feat.

data.name: Dastardly Finish
data.prerequisites: Sneak attack +5d6.
data.description: You can take advantage of an enemy's debilitated state to attempt a coup de grace.
data.benefit: You can deliver a coup de grace to cowering or stunned targets.
data.normal: You can only coup de grace helpless targets.

data.name: Dazing Assault
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +11.
data.description: You can daze foes with wild attacks.
data.benefit: You can choose to take a -5 penalty on all melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to daze opponents you hit with your melee attacks for 1 round, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the attack. A successful Fortitude save negates the effect. The DC of this save is 10 + your base attack bonus. You must choose to use this feat before making the attack roll, and its effects last until your next turn.

data.name: Dazing Spell
data.description: You can daze creatures with the power of your spells.
data.benefit: You can modify a spell to daze a creature damaged by the spell. When a creature takes damage from this spell, they become dazed for a number of rounds equal to the original level of the spell. If the spell allows a saving throw, a successful save negates the daze effect. If the spell does not allow a save, the target can make a Will save to negate the daze effect. If the spell effect also causes the creature to become dazed, the duration of this metamagic effect is added to the duration of the spell. A dazing spell uses up a spell slot three levels higher than the spell's actual level. Spells that do not inflict damage do not benefit from this feat.

data.name: Deep Drinker
data.prerequisites: Con 13, monk level 11, drunken ki class feature.
data.description: You draw greater amounts of ki from your libations.
data.benefit: When you gain temporary ki from drunken ki, you gain 2 temporary ki rather than just 1.

data.name: Deepsight
data.prerequisites: Darkvision 60 feet.
data.description: Your senses are especially keen in the utter darkness.
data.benefit: Your darkvision has a range of 120 feet.
data.normal: Darkvision normally extends 60 or 90 feet.

data.name: Disarming Strike
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Disarm, base attack bonus +9.
data.description: Your critical hits can disarm your foes.
data.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee attack, you can disarm your opponent, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the attack. If your confirmation roll exceeds your opponent's CMD, you may disarm your opponent as if from the disarm combat maneuver. This does not provoke an attack of opportunity.
data.normal: You must perform a disarm combat maneuver to disarm an opponent.
data.special: You can only apply the effects of one of the following feats to a given critical hit: Bull Rush Strike, Disarming Strike, Repositioning Strike, Sundering Strike, or Tripping Strike. You may choose to use this feat after you make your confirmation roll.

data.name: Disrupting Shot
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Point-Blank Shot, fighter level 6th.
data.description: With a well-placed shot, you make it harder for a nearby opponent to cast spells.
data.benefit: If you ready an action to shoot an opponent casting a spell within 30 feet and successfully hit that opponent with a ranged attack, the concentration DC to successfully cast the spell is increased by +4.

data.name: Disruptive Spell
data.description: Your magical energies cling to enemies, interfering with their spellcasting.
data.benefit: Targets affected by a disruptive spell must make concentration checks when using spells or spell-like abilities (DC equals the save DC of the disruptive spell plus the level of the spell being cast) for 1 round. Targets that avoid the spell's effects avoid this feat's effect as well. A disruptive spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

data.name: Diviner's Delving
data.prerequisites: Spell Focus (divination).
data.description: Your keen magical intuition makes reading signs, portents, and mystical clues quick and easy.
data.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on caster level checks with divinations to overcome spell resistance or effects that impede divination (for example, nondetection). When using a divination spell that requires concentration, you gain information from the spell 1 round sooner than normal (so you gain information from the first 2 rounds with 1 round of concentration, and information from the third round in the second round of concentration).

data.name: Dreadful Carnage
data.prerequisites: Str 15, Power Attack, Furious Focus, base attack bonus +11.
data.description: Slaying an enemy demoralizes your other nearby foes.
data.benefit: Whenever you reduce an enemy to 0 or fewer hit points, you can make an Intimidate check to demoralize all enemies within 30 feet as a free action. Enemies that cannot see both you and the enemy you reduced to 0 or fewer hit points are unaffected.

data.name: Duck and Cover
data.description: Your allies assist you in avoiding certain attacks.
data.benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, and both of you are required to make a Ref lex saving throw against a spell or effect, you may take the result of your die roll or that of your ally (your modifiers still apply to the roll, regardless of which result you take). If you take your ally's result, you are knocked prone (or staggered on your next turn, if you are already prone or cannot be knocked prone). In addition, you receive a +2 cover bonus to your AC against ranged attacks as long as your ally is wielding a shield.

data.name: Eagle Eyes
data.prerequisites: Wis 13, keen senses racial trait.
data.description: Your vision is especially keen.
data.benefit: You ignore up to -5 in penalties due to distance on visual Perception checks, allowing you to see accurately at much greater distances than most.

data.name: Eclectic
data.prerequisites: Human.
data.description: You have a talent for picking up different vocations.
data.benefit: Choose an additional favored class and gain either +1 hit point or +1 skill point whenever you take a level in that class. If you choose a class in which you already have levels, the benefits of this feat are retroactive.

data.name: Ectoplasmic Spell
data.description: Your spells breach the gulf between dimensions, sending ghostly emanations into the ether.
data.benefit: An ectoplasmic spell has full effect against incorporeal or ethereal creatures. An ectoplasmic spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

data.name: Eldritch Claws
data.prerequisites: Str 15, natural weapons, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: Who needs magic weapons? Eldritch tricks are no match for your bestial ferocity.
data.benefit: You natural weapons are considered both magic and silver for purpose of overcoming damage reduction.

data.name: Elemental Fist
data.prerequisites: Con 13, Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8.
data.description: You empower your strike with elemental energy
data.benefit: When you use Elemental Strike pick one of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. On a successful hit, the attack deals damage normally plus 1d6 points of damage of the chosen type. You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your attack roll (thus a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). You may attempt an elemental fist attack once per day for every four levels you have attained (see Special), and no more than once per round.
data.special: A monk of the four winds receives Elemental Fist as a bonus feat at 1st level, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. A monk may attempt an Elemental Fist attack a number of times per day equal to his monk level, plus one more time per day for every four levels he has in classes other than monk.

data.name: Elemental Focus
data.description: Your spells of a certain element are more difficult to resist.
data.benefit: Choose one energy type (acid, cold, electricity, or fire). Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells that deal damage of the energy type you select.
data.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, it applies to a new energy type.

data.name: Elemental Spell
data.description: You can manipulate the elemental nature of your spells.
data.benefit: Choose one energy type: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. You may replace a spell's normal damage with that energy type or split the spell's damage, so that half is of that energy type and half is of its normal type. An elemental spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.
data.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time you must choose a different energy type.

data.name: Elven Accuracy
data.prerequisites: Elf.
data.description: Your sharp eyesight makes difficult shots easier.
data.benefit: If you miss due to concealment when making a ranged attack with a longbow or shortbow (including composite bows), you can reroll your miss chance roll one time to see if you actually hit.

data.name: Enforcer
data.prerequisites: Intimidate 1 rank.
data.description: You are skilled at causing fear in those you brutalize.
data.benefit: Whenever you deal nonlethal damage with a melee weapon, you can make an Intimidate check to demoralize your target as a free action. If you are successful, the target is shaken for a number of rounds equal to the damage dealt. If your attack was a critical hit, your target is frightened for 1 round with a successful Intimidate check, as well as being shaken for a number of rounds equal to the damage dealt.

data.name: Expanded Arcana
data.prerequisites: Caster level 1st, see Special.
data.description: Your research has revealed new spells.
data.benefit: Add one spell from your class's spell list to your list of spells known. This is in addition to the number of spells normally gained at each new level in your class. You may instead add two spells from your class's spell list to your list of spells known, but both of these spells must be at least one level lower than the highest level spell you can cast in that class. Once made, these choices cannot be changed.
data.special: You can only take this feat if you possess levels in a class whose spellcasting relies on a limited list of spells known, such as the bard, oracle, and sorcerer. You can gain Expanded Arcana multiple times.

data.name: Extra Bombs
data.prerequisites: Bomb class feature.
data.description: You can throw more bombs per day.
data.benefit: You can throw two additional bombs per day.
data.special: You can gain Extra Bombs multiple times. Its effects stack.

data.name: Extra Discovery
data.prerequisites: Discovery class feature.
data.description: You have made a new alchemical discovery.
data.benefit: You gain one additional discovery. You must meet all of the prerequisites for this discovery.
data.special: You can gain Extra Discovery multiple times.

data.name: Extra Hex
data.prerequisites: Hex class feature.
data.description: You have learned the secrets of a new hex.
data.benefit: You gain one additional hex. You must meet all of the prerequisites for this hex.
data.special: You can gain Extra Hex multiple times.

data.name: Extra Rage Power
data.prerequisites: Rage power class feature.
data.description: You have unlocked a new ability to use while raging.
data.benefit: You gain one additional rage power. You must meet all of the prerequisites for this rage power.
data.special: You can gain Extra Rage Power multiple times.

data.name: Extra Revelation
data.prerequisites: Revelation class feature.
data.description: You have discovered a new aspect of your mystery.
data.benefit: You gain one additional revelation. You must meet all of the prerequisites for this revelation.
data.special: You can gain Extra Revelation multiple times.

data.name: Extra Rogue Talent
data.prerequisites: Rogue talent class feature.
data.description: Through constant practice, you have learned how to perform a special trick.
data.benefit: You gain one additional rogue talent. You must meet all of the prerequisites for this rogue talent.
data.special: You can gain Extra Rogue Talent multiple times.

data.name: Fast Drinker
data.prerequisites: Con 18, drunken ki class feature.
data.description: You swiftly guzzle spirits to draw forth ki.
data.benefit: Drinking strong alcohol to gain temporary ki, takes a swift action rather than a standard action.

data.name: Fast Healer
data.prerequisites: Con 13, Diehard, Endurance.
data.description: You benefit greatly from your healing, be it from spells or natural healing.
data.benefit: When you regain hit points by resting or through magical healing, you recover additional hit points equal to half your Constitution modifier (minimum +1).

data.name: Favored Defense
data.prerequisites: Favored enemy class feature.
data.description: Your cunning is your shield against your quarry's attacks.
data.benefit: Choose one of your favored enemy types. You add half your favored enemy bonus to your CMD and as a dodge bonus to AC when attacked by a favored enemy.
data.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, it applies to a new favored enemy type.

data.name: Fight On
data.prerequisites: Con 13; dwarf, half-orc, or orc.
data.description: You can keep fighting even after you should be dead.
data.benefit: Once per day, you can gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier. You can activate this feat as an immediate action when reduced to 0 or fewer hit points. You can use this feat to prevent yourself from dying. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. If your hit points drop below 0 due to the loss of these temporary hit points, you fall unconscious and are dying as normal. If you also have the ferocity racial trait, you can use that once you have lost the temporary hit points from this feat.

data.name: Focused Shot
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot.
data.description: Your anatomical insight adds deadliness to your shots.
data.benefit: As a standard action, you may make an attack with a bow or crossbow and add your Intelligence modifier on the damage roll. You must be within 30 feet of your target to deal this extra damage. Creatures immune to critical hits and sneak attacks are immune to this extra damage.
data.special: Starting at 2nd level, a ranger with the archery combat style may select Focused Shot as a combat style feat.

data.name: Focused Spell
data.description: When you cast a spell that affects more than one creature, one opponent finds it more difficult to resist.
data.benefit: When casting a spell that affects or targets more than one creature, you can choose one target or creature within the spell effect. That creature's saving throw DC to resist the spell is increased by +2. You must choose which target to focus the spell on before casting the spell. A focused spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level. Spells that do not require a saving throw to resist or lessen the spell's effect do not benefit from this feat.

data.name: Following Step
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Step Up.
data.description: You can repeatedly close the distance when foes try to move away, without impeding your normal movement.
data.benefit: When using the Step Up feat to follow an adjacent foe, you may move up to 10 feet. You may still take a 5-foot step during your next turn, and any movement you make using this feat does not subtract any distance from your movement during your next turn.
data.normal: You can only take a 5-foot step to follow an opponent using Step Up.

data.name: Furious Focus
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.
data.description: Even in the midst of fierce and furious blows, you can find focus in the carnage and your seemingly wild blows strike home.
data.benefit: When you are wielding a two-handed weapon or a one-handed weapon with two hands, and using the Power Attack feat, you do not suffer Power Attack's penalty on melee attack rolls on the first attack you make each turn. You still suffer the penalty on any additional attacks, including attacks of opportunity.

data.name: Gang Up
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise.
data.description: You are adept at using greater numbers against foes.
data.benefit: You are considered to be flanking an opponent if at least two of your allies are threatening that opponent, regardless of your actual positioning.
data.normal: You must be positioned opposite an ally to f lank an opponent.

data.name: Gnome Trickster
data.prerequisites: Cha 13, gnome, gnome magic racial trait.
data.description: Your arcane talents go beyond the illusory.
data.benefit: In addition to your normal gnome spell-like abilities, you also gain the following spell-like abilities: 1/day-mage hand and prestidigitation.

data.name: Go Unnoticed
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Small size or smaller.
data.description: Your small size lets you quickly duck out of sight.
data.benefit: During the first round of combat, flat-footed opponents are considered not to have noticed you yet for the purposes of Stealth skill checks, allowing you to make a Stealth check that round to hide from them.

data.name: Greater Blind-Fight
data.prerequisites: Perception 15 ranks, Improved Blind-Fight.
data.description: Your enemies cannot hide from you.
data.benefit: Your melee attacks ignore the miss chance for less than total concealment, and you treat opponents with total concealment as if they had normal concealment (20% miss chance instead of 50%). You may still reroll a miss chance percentile roll as normal. If you successfully pinpoint an invisible or hidden attacker, that attacker gets no advantages related to hitting you with ranged attacks, regardless of the range. That is, you don't lose your Dexterity bonus to Armor Class, and the attacker doesn't get the usual +2 bonus for being invisible.
data.special: The Greater Blind-Fight feat is of no use against a character who is the subject of a blink spell.

data.name: Greater Dirty Trick
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Dirty Trick, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: When you pull a dirty trick, your foe is truly hindered.
data.benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to attempt a dirty trick. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Dirty Trick. Whenever you successfully perform a dirty trick, the penalty lasts for 1d4 rounds, plus 1 round for every 5 by which your attack exceeds the target's CMD. In addition, removing the condition requires the target to spend a standard action.
data.normal: The condition imposed by a dirty trick lasts for 1 round plus 1 round for every 5 by which your attack exceeds the target's CMD. Removing the condition requires the target to spend a move action.

data.name: Greater Drag
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Improved Drag, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: Foes that you drag are thrown out of balance.
data.benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to drag a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Drag. Whenever you drag a foe, his movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all of your allies (but not you).
data.normal: Creatures moved by drag do not provoke attacks of opportunity.

data.name: Greater Elemental Focus
data.prerequisites: Elemental Focus.
data.description: Choose an energy type to which you have already applied the Elemental Focus feat. Any spells you cast of this energy type are very hard to resist.
data.benefit: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells that deal damage of the energy type you select. This bonus stacks with the bonus from Elemental Focus.
data.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, it applies to a new energy type to which you have already applied the Elemental Focus feat.

data.name: Greater Reposition
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Reposition, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: When you reposition foes, they are left vulnerable to the attacks of your allies.
data.benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to reposition a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Reposition. Whenever you reposition a foe, his movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all of your allies (but not you).
data.normal: Creatures moved by reposition do not provoke attacks of opportunity.

data.name: Greater Shield Specialization
data.prerequisites: Proficiency with selected shield, Greater Shield Focus, Shield Focus, Shield Specialization with selected shield, fighter level 12th.
data.description: Your masterful shieldwork provides even greater protection to your vital areas.
data.benefit: Choose one type of shield (buckler, light, heavy, or tower shield) for which you possess the Shield Specialization feat. With the selected shield, you gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class against critical hit confirmation rolls (this bonus stacks with that from Shield Specialization). In addition, once per day you may negate a critical hit, and damage is instead rolled normally.
data.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of shield.

data.name: Greater Steal
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Steal, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: You have a knack for snatching items from your opponents in combat.
data.benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to steal an item from a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Steal. If you successfully steal an item from a foe during combat, it does not notice the theft until after combat is over or if it attempts to use the missing item.
data.normal: Creatures automatically notice items taken from them through the steal combat maneuver.

data.name: Groundling
data.prerequisites: Cha 13, gnome, gnome magic racial trait.
data.description: You can speak with burrowing animals.
data.benefit: You can use speak with animals as a spell-like ability at will, but only to communicate with burrowing animals like gophers, moles, and the like. You can still use your gnome speak with animals ability once per day to speak with any animal, as usual.

data.name: Heroic Defiance
data.prerequisites: Diehard, Endurance, base Fortitude save +8.
data.description: You struggle on when others would fall.
data.benefit: Once per day as an immediate action you can delay the onset of one harmful condition or affliction (such as panicked, paralyzed, stunned, and so on), including permanent and instantaneous conditions. Activating this feat delays the onset of the condition until the end of your next turn, after which time the condition takes its normal effect. This feat has no effect on hit point damage or ability damage.

data.name: Heroic Recovery
data.prerequisites: Diehard, Endurance, base Fortitude save +4.
data.description: You can throw off the effects of crippling conditions.
data.benefit: Once per day as a standard action you may attempt a new saving throw against a harmful condition or affliction requiring a Fortitude save that is affecting you. If this save against the affliction fails, there is no additional effect, but a successful save counts toward curing an affliction such as poison or disease. You cannot use this feat to recover from instantaneous effects, effects that do not allow a saving throw, or effects that do not require a Fortitude save.

data.name: Improved Blind-Fight
data.prerequisites: Perception 10 ranks, Blind-Fight.
data.description: Your keen senses guide your hand against hidden foes.
data.benefit: Your melee attacks ignore the miss chance for less than total concealment. You may still reroll your miss chance percentile roll for total concealment. If you successfully pinpoint an invisible or hidden attacker within 30 feet, that attacker gets no advantages related to hitting you with ranged attacks. That is, you don't lose your Dexterity bonus to Armor Class, and the attacker doesn't get the usual +2 bonus for being invisible.
data.special: The Improved Blind-Fight feat is of no use against a character who is the subject of a blink spell.

data.name: Improved Dirty Trick
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise.
data.description: You are skilled at pulling dirty tricks on your foes.
data.benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a dirty trick combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to attempt a dirty trick. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries a dirty trick on you.
data.normal: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a dirty trick combat maneuver.

data.name: Improved Drag
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.
data.description: You are skilled at dragging foes around the battlefield.
data.benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a drag combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to drag a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries to drag you.
data.normal: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a drag combat maneuver.

data.name: Improved Ki Throw
data.prerequisites: Improved Bull Rush, Ki Throw.
data.description: Your enemies are living weapons in your hands.
data.benefit: When using the Ki Throw feat, you may throw your target into any square you threaten that is occupied by another creature. Make a bull rush combat maneuver check with a -4 penalty against the secondary target. If this check succeeds, the thrown creature lands prone in the secondary target's square, while the secondary target is pushed back and knocked prone in an adjacent square. If the check fails, the thrown creature lands prone in the nearest square you threaten adjacent to the secondary target. If you throw a Large or larger creature into an area containing multiple secondary targets, you take an additional penalty of -4 on your combat maneuver check for each target after the first.
data.special: A monk may take this as a bonus feat at 14th level.

data.name: Improved Reposition
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise.
data.description: You have learned how to force your enemies to move around the battlefield.
data.benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a reposition combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to reposition a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries to reposition you.
data.normal: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a reposition combat maneuver.

data.name: Improved Second Chance
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Second Chance, base attack bonus +11.
data.description: You can turn a missed strike into a second chance without sacrificing later attacks.
data.benefit: When you reroll a missed attack using the Second Chance feat, you can still make the rest of your attacks that turn, albeit at a -5 penalty to each attack.
data.normal: When using the Second Chance feat, you must normally forgo the rest of your attacks that turn.

data.name: Improved Share Spells
data.prerequisites: Spellcraft 10 ranks, ability to acquire an animal companion, eidolon, familiar, or special mount.
data.description: You can share spells with those you have a magical connection with.
data.benefit: Any non-instantaneous spell (but not any spell-like ability) you cast on yourself can also affect a creature bonded to you (such as an animal companion, eidolon, familiar, or special mount). The creature must be within 5 feet of you at the time of casting to receive the benefit. The spell's duration is halved between you and your bonded creature (for example, a spell with a duration of 1 hour has a duration of 30 minutes for both you and your bonded creature). If the spell or effect has a duration other than instantaneous, it stops affecting the creature if it moves farther than 5 feet away from you. It does not affect the creature again if it returns before the duration expires. You may share spells in this fashion even if the spells normally do not affect creatures of that type. This feat only applies to animal companions, eidolons, familiars, or special mounts gained through a class feature.

data.name: Improved Sidestep
data.prerequisites: Dex 15, Dodge, Mobility, Sidestep.
data.description: You are adept at sidestepping your opponent's melee attacks without compromising your mobility.
data.benefit: After sidestepping an opponent's missed attack using the Sidestep feat, you may still take a 5-foot step during your next turn, or you may move up to your full speed if you take an action to move during your next turn.
data.normal: If you use the Sidestep feat, you cannot take a 5-foot step during your next turn.

data.name: Improved Steal
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise.
data.description: You have a knack for snatching items from your opponents.
data.benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a steal combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to steal an item from a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries to steal an item from you.
data.normal: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a steal combat maneuver.

data.name: Improved Stonecunning
data.prerequisites: Wis 13, dwarf, stonecunning racial trait.
data.description: Your sense for stonework is uncanny.
data.benefit: You receive a +4 bonus on Perception checks to notice unusual stonework. This bonus replaces the stonecunning ability's normal bonus on Perception checks.

data.name: Intensified Spell
data.description: Your spells can go beyond several normal limitations.
data.benefit: An intensified spell increases the maximum number of damage dice by 5 levels. You must actually have sufficient caster levels to surpass the maximum in order to benefit from this feat. No other variables of the spell are affected, and spells that inflict damage that is not modified by caster level are not affected by this feat. An intensified spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

data.name: In Harm's Way
data.prerequisites: Bodyguard.
data.description: You put yourself in danger's path to save your allies.
data.benefit: While using the aid another action to improve an adjacent ally's AC, you can intercept a successful attack against that ally as an immediate action, taking full damage from that attack and any associated effects (bleed, poison, etc.). A creature cannot benefit from this feat more than once per attack.

data.name: Ironguts
data.prerequisites: Con 13; dwarf, half-orc, or orc.
data.description: You have an especially strong stomach.
data.benefit: You gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against any effect causing the nauseated or sickened conditions and against all ingested poisons (but not other poisons). In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on Survival skill checks to find food for yourself (and only yourself ).

data.name: Ironhide
data.prerequisites: Con 13; dwarf, half-orc, or orc.
data.description: Your skin is thicker and more resilient than that of most of your people.
data.benefit: You gain a +1 natural armor bonus due to your unusually tough hide.

data.name: Keen Scent
data.prerequisites: Wis 13, half-orc or orc.
data.description: Your nose is as sensitive as that of a wild predator.
data.benefit: You gain the scent special ability.

data.name: Ki Throw
data.prerequisites: Improved Trip, Improved Unarmed Strike.
data.description: Your physical control and mastery of momentum allows you to throw enemies.
data.benefit: On a successful unarmed trip attack against a target your size or smaller, you may throw the target prone in any square you threaten rather than its own square. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity, and you cannot throw the creature into a space occupied by other creatures.
data.special: A monk may gain Ki Throw as a bonus feat at 10th level. A monk with this feat can affect creatures larger than his own size by spending 1 ki point per size category difference.

data.name: Leaf Singer
data.prerequisites: Cha 13, bardic performance class feature, elf or half-elf.
data.description: Your songs recount the ways and mysteries of your people.
data.benefit: When you use bardic performance with audible components in a forest, the range or area of your chosen performance is doubled. In addition, the DC for saving throws against your bardic performance is increased by +2 for creatures of the fey type, regardless of where the performance occurs.

data.name: Light Step
data.prerequisites: Acrobatic Steps, Nimble Moves, elf.
data.description: You pick your way nimbly through even the most dangerous and uneven terrain.
data.benefit: You can ignore the effects of difficult terrain in natural environments, as if it were normal terrain.

data.name: Lingering Performance
data.prerequisites: Bardic performance class feature.
data.description: The effects of your bardic performance carry on, even after you have stopped performing.
data.benefit: The bonuses and penalties from your bardic performance continue for 2 rounds after you cease performing. Any other requirement, such as range or specific conditions, must still be met for the effect to continue. If you begin a new bardic performance during this time, the effects of the previous performance immediately cease.

data.name: Lingering Spell
data.description: You spell clings to existence, slowly fading from the world.
data.benefit: You may cause an instantaneous spell that affects an area to persist until the beginning of your next turn. Those already in the area suffer no additional harm, but other creatures or objects entering the area are subject to its effects. A lingering spell with a visual manifestation obscures vision, providing concealment (20% miss chance) beyond 5 feet and total concealment (50% miss chance) beyond 20 feet. A lingering spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

data.name: Lookout
data.description: Your allies help you avoid being surprised.
data.benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, you may act in the surprise round as long as your ally would normally be able to act in the surprise round. If you would normally be denied the ability to act in the surprise round, your initiative is equal to your initiative roll or the roll of your ally -1, whichever is lower. If both you and your ally would be able to act in the surprise round without the aid of this feat, you may take both a standard and a move action (or a full-round action) during the surprise round.

data.name: Low Profile
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Small size or smaller.
data.description: Yours small stature helps you avoid ranged attacks.
data.benefit: You gain a +1 dodge bonus to AC against ranged attacks. In addition, you do not provide soft cover to creatures when ranged attacks pass through your square.

data.name: Lucky Halfling
data.prerequisites: Halfling.
data.description: You bring luck to those with whom you travel.
data.benefit: Once per day, when one of your allies within 30 feet makes a saving throw, you may roll the same saving throw as if you were the one subject to the effect requiring it. You may use this ability after your ally has rolled, but before the GM declares if the roll was a success or failure. Your ally may choose to use your saving throw in place of his own.

data.name: Major Spell Expertise
data.prerequisites: Minor Spell Expertise, ability to cast 9th-level spells.
data.description: You can cast a single low-level spell as a spell-like ability.
data.benefit: Choose one spell that you know of 5th level or lower. You may cast that spell twice per day as a spelllike ability. The caster level for this spell-like ability is equal to your caster level in the class from whose spell list the spell is taken. The spell-like ability's save DC is Charisma-based. If the spell has an expensive focus or material component, it may not be chosen for this feat. You cannot apply metamagic feats to this spell.
data.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new spell.

data.name: Master Alchemist
data.prerequisites: Craft (alchemy) 5 ranks.
data.description: Your mastery of alchemy is nearly supernatural.
data.benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on Craft (alchemy) checks, and you may create mundane alchemical items much more quickly than normal. When making poisons, you can create a number of doses equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1) at one time. These additional doses do not increase the time required, but they do increase the raw material cost. In addition, whenever you make alchemical items or poisons using Craft (alchemy), use the item's gp value as its sp value when determining your progress (do not multiply the item's gp cost by 10 to determine its sp cost).

data.name: Merciful Spell
data.description: Your damaging spells subdue rather than kill.
data.benefit: You can alter spells that inflict damage to inflict nonlethal damage instead. Spells that inflict damage of a particular type (such as fire) inflict nonlethal damage of that same type. A merciful spell does not use up a higher-level spell slot than the spell's actual level.

data.name: Minor Spell Expertise
data.prerequisites: Ability to cast 4th-level spells.
data.description: You are able to cast a 1st-level spell as a spell-like ability.
data.benefit: Choose one 1st-level spell that you know. You may cast that spell twice per day as a spell-like ability. The caster level for this spell-like ability is equal to your caster level in the class from whose spell list the spell is taken. The spell-like ability's save DC is Charisma-based. If the spell has an expensive focus or material component, it may not be chosen for this feat. You cannot apply metamagic feats to this spell.
data.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new spell.

data.name: Missile Shield
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Shield Focus.
data.description: You are skilled at def lecting ranged attacks with your shield.
data.benefit: You must be using a light, heavy, or tower shield to use this feat. Once per round when you would normally be hit with an attack from a ranged weapon (not including spell effects, natural attacks, or massive ranged weapons), you may def lect it so that you take no damage, as if you had the Def lect Arrows feat. You must be aware of the attack and not flat-footed.

data.name: Mounted Shield
data.prerequisites: Mounted Combat, Shield Focus.
data.description: Your defensive tactics defend both you and your mount.
data.benefit: You may add your base shield bonus (including the bonus from Shield Focus but not including enhancement bonuses) to your mount's AC. In addition, you may add this bonus when making a Ride check to negate a hit against your mount using the Mounted Combat feat.

data.name: Mounted Skirmisher
data.prerequisites: Ride rank 14, Mounted Combat, Trick Riding.
data.description: You are adept at attacking from upon a swift moving steed.
data.benefit: If your mount moves its speed or less, you can still take a full-attack action.
data.normal: If your mount moves more than 5 feet, you can only take an attack action.

data.name: Outflank
data.prerequisites: Base attack bonus +4.
data.description: You look for every edge when flanking an enemy.
data.benefit: Whenever you and an ally who also has this feat are flanking the same creature, your flanking bonus on attack rolls increases to +4. In addition, whenever you score a critical hit against the flanked creature, it provokes an attack of opportunity from your ally.

data.name: Paired Opportunists
data.description: You know how to make an enemy pay for lax defenses.
data.benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, you receive a +4 circumstance bonus on attacks of opportunity against creatures that you both threaten. Enemies that provoke attacks of opportunity from your ally also provoke attacks of opportunity from you so long as you threaten them (even if the situation or an ability would normally deny you the attack of opportunity). This does not allow you to take more than one attack of opportunity against a creature for a given action.

data.name: Parry Spell
data.prerequisites: Spellcraft 15 ranks, Improved Counterspell.
data.description: You can throw an enemy spell back at its caster.
data.benefit: Whenever you successfully counter a spell, it returns back to its caster. This works exactly like the spell turning spell (Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook page 347).

data.name: Parting Shot
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Dodge, Mobility, Point Blank Shot, Shot on the Run, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: You are an expert skirmisher, able to rain missiles upon your enemies whether advancing or retreating.
data.benefit: Once per encounter, when using the withdraw action, you can make a single ranged attack at any point during your movement.
data.normal: You cannot attack when using the withdraw action.
data.special: Starting at 6th level, a ranger with the archery combat style may select Parting Shot as a combat style feat.

data.name: Pass For Human
data.prerequisites: Half-elf, half-orc, or halfling (see Special).
data.description: You're easily mistaken for a human rather than a member of your own race.
data.benefit: You receive a +10 bonus on Disguise checks to disguise yourself as a human, and do not receive the penalty for disguising yourself as a member of another race when you do so. In areas largely populated or settled by humans, you can take 10 on your Disguise check, meaning most people tend to assume you are human unless given a reason to think otherwise.
data.special: A half ling may take this feat, but must have the Childlike feat as a prerequisite. The benefits of the two feats stack.

data.name: Perfect Strike
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8.
data.description: When wielding a monk weapon, your attacks can be extremely precise.
data.benefit: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your attack roll (thus a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). You must use one of the following weapons to make the attack: kama, nunchaku, quarterstaff, sai, and siangham. You can roll your attack roll twice and take the higher result. If one of these rolls is a critical threat, the other roll is used as your confirmation roll (your choice if they are both critical threats). You may attempt a perfect attack once per day for every four levels you have attained (but see Special), and no more than once per round.
data.special: A weapon master monk or zen archer monk receives Perfect Strike as a bonus feat at 1st level, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. A monk may attempt an perfect strike attack a number of times per day equal to his monk level, plus one more time per day for every four levels he has in classes other than monk.

data.name: Persistent Spell
data.description: You can modify a spell to become more tenacious when its targets resist its effect.
data.benefit: Whenever a creature targeted by a persistent spell or within its area succeeds on its saving throw against the spell, it must make another saving throw against the effect. If a creature fails this second saving throw, it suffers the full effects of the spell, as if it had failed its first saving throw. A persistent spell uses up a spell slot two levels higher than the spell's actual level. Spells that do not require a saving throw to resist or lessen the spell's effect do not benefit from this feat.

data.name: Point Blank Master
data.prerequisites: Weapon Specialization with selected ranged weapon.
data.description: You are adept at firing ranged weapons in close quarters.
data.benefit: Choose one type of ranged weapon. You do not provoke attacks of opportunity when firing the selected weapon while threatened.
data.normal: Using a ranged weapon while you are threatened provokes attacks of opportunity.
data.special: Starting at 6th level, a ranger with the archery combat style may select Point Blank Master as a combat style feat, but he must have Weapon Focus instead of Weapon Specialization in the selected weapon.

data.name: Practiced Tactician
data.prerequisites: Tactician class feature.
data.description: With only a few quick gestures and commands, you can direct others in combat.
data.benefit: You can use your tactician ability to grant allies a teamwork feat one additional time per day.
data.special: You can gain Practiced Tactician multiple times. Its effects stack.

data.name: Precise Strike
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, base attack bonus +1.
data.description: You are skilled at striking where it counts, as long as an ally distracts your foe.
data.benefit: Whenever you and an ally who also has this feat are flanking the same the creature, you deal an additional 1d6 points of precision damage with each successful melee attack. This bonus damage stacks with other sources of precision damage, such as sneak attack. This bonus damage is not multiplied on a critical hit.

data.name: Preferred Spell
data.prerequisites: Spellcraft 5 ranks, Heighten Spell.
data.description: You find it very easy to cast one particular spell.
data.benefit: Choose one spell which you have the ability to cast. You can cast that spell spontaneously by sacrificing a prepared spell or spell slot of equal or higher level. You can apply any metamagic feats you possess to this spell when you cast it. This increases the minimum level of the prepared spell or spell slot you must sacrifice in order to cast it but does not affect the casting time.
data.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a different spell.

data.name: Punishing Kick
data.prerequisites: Con 13, Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8.
data.description: Your kicks are so powerful you use them to push or knock back your foes.
data.benefit: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your attack roll (thus a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). On a successful hit, the attack deals damage normally and you can choose to push your target 5 feet or attempt to knock them prone. If you decide to push the target, it is moved 5 feet directly away from you. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity, and the target must end this move in a safe space it can stand in. If you decide to attempt to knock the target prone, the target receives a Fortitude saving throw with a DC of 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wisdom modifier to avoid the effect. You may attempt a punishing kick attack once per day for every four levels you have attained (but see Special), and no more than once per round.
data.special: A hungry ghost monk receives Punishing Kick as a bonus feat at 1st level, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. A monk may attempt a punishing kick attack a number of times per day equal to his monk level, plus one more time per day for every four levels he has in classes other than monk.

data.name: Pushing Assault
data.prerequisites: Str 15, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.
data.description: A strike made with a two-handed weapon can push a similar sized opponent backward.
data.benefit: When you hit a creature your size or smaller with a two-handed weapon attack modif ied by the Power Attack feat, you can choose to push the target 5 feet directly away from you instead of dealing the extra damage from Power Attack. If you score a critical hit, you can instead push the target 10 feet directly away from you. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunities, and the target must end this move in a safe space it can stand in. You choose which effect to apply after the attack roll has been made, but before the damage is rolled.

data.name: Racial Heritage
data.prerequisites: Human.
data.description: The blood of a non-human ancestor flows in your veins.
data.benefit: Choose another humanoid race. You count as both human and that race for any effects related to race. For example, if you choose dwarf, you are considered both a human and a dwarf for the purpose of taking traits, feats, how spells and magic items affect you, and so on.

data.name: Raging Vitality
data.prerequisites: Con 15, rage class feature.
data.description: While raging, you are full of vigor and health.
data.benefit: Whenever you are raging, the morale bonus to your Constitution increases by +2. Your rage does not end if you become unconscious. While unconscious you must still expend rounds of rage per day each round.

data.name: Ray Shield
data.prerequisites: Dex 15, Missile Shield, Spellbreaker.
data.description: You can even deflect rays with your shield.
data.benefit: You must be using a light, heavy, or tower shield to use this feat. Once per round when you would normally be hit with a ranged touch attack (including rays and similar magical effects), you may def lect it so that you take no damage from it. Your shield suffers the full effects of the spell or effect, if applicable.

data.name: Razortusk
data.prerequisites: Half-orc.
data.description: Your powerful jaws and steely teeth are deadly enough to give you a bite attack.
data.benefit: You can make a bite attack for 1d4 points of damage, plus your Strength modifier. You're considered proficient in this attack and can apply feats or effects appropriate to natural attacks to it. If used as part of a full attack action, the bite is considered a secondary attack and is made at your full base attack bonus -5, and adds half your Strength modifier to damage.

data.name: Reach Spell
data.description: Your spells go farther than normal.
data.benefit: You can alter a spell with a range of touch, close, or medium to increase its range to a higher range category, using the following order: touch, close, medium, and long. A reach spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level for each increase in range category. For example, a spell with a range of touch increased to long range uses up a spell slot three levels higher. Spells modif ied by this feat that require melee touch attacks instead require ranged touch attacks. Spells that do not have a range of touch, close, or medium do not benefit from this feat.

data.name: Rending Claws
data.prerequisites: Str 13, two claw natural weapon attacks, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: Your claw attacks do greater harm to your enemy.
data.benefit: If you hit a creature with two claw attacks in the same turn, the second claw attack deals an additional 1d6 points of damage. This damage is precision damage and is not multiplied on a critical hit. You can use this feat once per round.

data.name: Repositioning Strike
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Reposition, base attack bonus +9.
data.description: Your critical hits can move your foes where you wish.
data.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee attack, you can move your opponent, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the attack. If your confirmation roll exceeds your opponent's CMD, you may move your opponent as if from the reposition combat maneuver. This does not provoke an attack of opportunity.
data.normal: You must perform a reposition combat maneuver to reposition an opponent.
