data.special: You can only apply the effects of one of the following feats to a given critical hit: Bull Rush Strike, Disarming Strike, Repositioning Strike, Sundering Strike, or Tripping Strike. You may choose to use this feat after you make your confirmation roll.

data.name: Saving Shield
data.prerequisites: Shield Proficiency.
data.description: You deflect attacks that could mean your ally's death.
data.benefit: Whenever an adjacent ally is the target of an attack, you can, as an immediate action, grant that adjacent ally a +2 shield bonus to AC. You must be wielding a light shield, heavy shield, or tower shield to use this feat.

data.name: Second Chance
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: Quick ref lexes turn missed strikes into second chances.
data.benefit: When making a full attack, if you miss on your first attack, you can forgo making any other attacks for the rest of your turn to reroll that attack at your highest base attack bonus.

data.name: Selective Spell
data.prerequisites: Spellcraft 10 ranks.
data.description: Your allies need not fear friendly fire.
data.benefit: When casting a selective spell with an area effect and a duration of instantaneous, you can choose a number of targets in the area equal to the ability score modifier used to determine bonus spells of the same type (Charisma for bards, oracles, paladins, sorcerers, and summoners; Intelligence for witches and wizards; Wisdom for clerics, druids, inquisitors, and rangers). These targets are excluded from the effects of your spell. A selective spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level. Spells that do not have an area of effect or a duration of instantaneous do not benefit from this feat.

data.name: Shadow Strike
data.prerequisites: Base attack bonus +1.
data.description: You accurately strike even those you cannot clearly see.
data.benefit: You can deal precision damage, such as sneak attack damage, against targets with concealment (but not total concealment).

data.name: Shared Insight
data.prerequisites: Wis 13, half-elf.
data.description: You deftly direct others' attentions where you wish.
data.benefit: As a move action, you can grant all friendly creatures within 30 feet who can see or hear you a +2 bonus on Perception checks for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1 round).

data.name: Sharp Senses
data.prerequisites: Keen senses racial trait.
data.description: Your senses are especially sharp, even for your kind.
data.benefit: You receive a +4 racial bonus on Perception skill checks. This replaces the normal bonus from the keen senses racial trait.
data.normal: The keen senses trait normally grants a +2 racial bonus on Perception skill checks.

data.name: Shield of Swings
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.
data.description: A wild frenzy of attacks serves to bolster your defenses.
data.benefit: When you take a full-attack action while wielding a two-handed weapon, you can choose to reduce the damage by 1/2 to gain a +4 shield bonus to AC and CMD until the beginning of your next turn. The reduction in damage applies until the beginning of your next turn.

data.name: Shield Specialization
data.prerequisites: Proficiency with selected shield, Shield Focus, fighter level 4th.
data.description: You have mastered the use of one type of shield.
data.benefit: Choose one type of shield (buckler, light, heavy, or tower shield). With the selected shield, you gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class against critical hit confirmation rolls. In addition, you may add your base shield bonus (including the bonus from Shield Focus but not including enhancement bonuses) to your CMD.
data.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of shield.

data.name: Shield Wall
data.prerequisites: Shield Proficiency.
data.description: You form a unified defense with those around you.
data.benefit: Whenever you are wielding a shield and are adjacent to an ally wielding a shield who also has this feat, the AC bonus from your shield increases, depending on the shield wielded by your ally. If your ally is wielding a buckler or a light shield, your shield bonus increases by +1. If your ally is wielding a heavy shield or a tower shield, your shield bonus increases by +2. You keep these bonuses even if your ally loses his shield bonus due to making a shield bash attack. If an adjacent ally with this feat uses a tower shield to grant total cover, you also benefit if an attack targeting you passes through the edge of the shield (Core Rulebook 153).

data.name: Shielded Caster
data.description: Your allies cover you while you cast complicated spells.
data.benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, you receive a +4 competence bonus on concentration checks. If your ally is wielding a buckler or a light shield, this bonus increases by +1. If your ally is wielding a heavy shield or a tower shield, this bonus increases by +2. Finally, if an enemy threatening you and your ally has the Disruptive feat, or another ability that increases the DC of concentration checks, the amount of the increase is halved.

data.name: Sickening Spell
data.description: You can sicken creatures with your spells.
data.benefit: You can modify a spell to sicken a creature damaged by the spell. When a creature takes damage from this spell, they become sickened for a number of rounds equal to the original level of the spell. If the spell allows a saving throw, a successful save negates the sickening effect. If the spell does not allow a save, the target can make a Fortitude save to negate the sickening effect. If the spell effect also causes the creature to become sickened, the duration of this metamagic effect is added on to the duration of the spell. A sickening spell uses up a spell slot two levels higher than the spell's actual level. Spells that do not inflict damage do not benefit from this feat.

data.name: Sidestep
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Dodge, Mobility.
data.description: You can reposition yourself after a foe's missed swing.
data.benefit: Whenever an opponent misses you with a melee attack, you may move 5 feet as an immediate action so long as you remain within that opponent's threatened area. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. If you take this step, you cannot take a 5-foot step during your next turn. If you take an action to move during your next turn, subtract 5 feet from your total movement.

data.name: Smash
data.prerequisites: Power Attack, half-orc.
data.description: You overcome obstacles by breaking them.
data.benefit: When you attack an inanimate, unattended object, you ignore the first 5 points of its hardness. You also receive a +5 bonus on Strength checks made to knock down or break open doors.
data.special: The benefits of this feat do not apply to sunder attempts or attacks against constructs, only attacks on inanimate, unattended objects.

data.name: Smell Fear
data.prerequisites: Keen Scent, half-orc or orc.
data.description: You can catch the sour scent of fear on the wind.
data.benefit: You receive a +4 bonus on Perception checks to detect creatures with the shaken, frightened, or panicked conditions using scent. You can substitute your Perception skill for Sense Motive skill checks if the subject has one of the previous conditions or is attempting to cover up their fear in some way.

data.name: Sociable
data.prerequisites: Cha 13, half-elf.
data.description: You have a way of helping others to get along.
data.benefit: As a move action, you grant all friendly creatures within 30 feet who can see or hear you (including yourself ) a +2 bonus on Diplomacy checks for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1 round).

data.name: Spell Perfection
data.prerequisites: Spellcraft 15 ranks, at least three metamagic feats.
data.description: You are unequaled at the casting of one particular spell.
data.benefit: Pick one spell which you have the ability to cast. Whenever you cast that spell you may apply any one metamagic feat you have to that spell without affecting its level or casting time, as long as the total modified level of the spell does not use a spell slot above 9th level. In addition, if you have other feats which allow you to apply a set numerical bonus to any aspect of this spell (such as Spell Focus, Spell Penetration, Weapon Focus [ray], and so on), double the bonus granted by that feat when applied to this spell.

data.name: Stabbing Shot
data.prerequisites: Rapid Shot, elf.
data.description: You can clear the way to continue using your bow.
data.benefit: When adjacent to an opponent and making a full-attack action with a longbow or shortbow (including composite bows), you may choose to make a melee attack against that opponent with a drawn arrow rather than firing it. If the attack hits-whether or not it does damage-your target is pushed back 5 feet away from you. You can then fire arrows from your bow normally, at the original target, or at another target within range. This melee attack replaces the extra attack from Rapid Shot, and all of your attack rolls for the round (the melee attack and the ranged attacks) take a -2 penalty. If your initial attack leaves you with no enemies threatening you, you can make the subsequent ranged attack or attacks without provoking attacks of opportunity.

data.name: Steel Soul
data.prerequisites: Dwarf, hardy racial trait.
data.description: You are especially resistant to magic.
data.benefit: You receive a +4 racial bonus on saving throws against spells and spell-like abilities. This replaces the normal bonus from the dwarf 's hardy racial trait.
data.normal: Dwarves normally receive a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against spells and spell-like abilities.

data.name: Step Up and Strike
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Following Step, Step Up, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: When a foe tries to move away, you can follow and make an attack.
data.benefit: When using the Step Up or Following Step feats to follow an adjacent foe, you may also make a single melee attack against that foe at your highest base attack bonus. This attack counts as one of your attacks of opportunity for the round. Using this feat does not count toward the number of actions you can usually take each round.
data.normal: You can usually only take one standard action and one 5-foot step each round.

data.name: Stone-Faced
data.prerequisites: Dwarf.
data.description: Rocks show more expression than you.
data.benefit: You receive a +4 bonus on Bluff checks to lie or conceal your feelings or true motives, but not to feint in combat or deliver secret messages. In addition, the DC for Sense Motive checks to get a hunch about you is 25 rather than 20.

data.name: Stone Sense
data.prerequisites: Improved Stonecunning, Perception 10 ranks.
data.description: You can feel movement in the very earth and stones around you.
data.benefit: You gain tremorsense to a range of 10 feet.

data.name: Stone Singer
data.prerequisites: Cha 13, bardic performance class feature, dwarf.
data.description: Your songs are in accordance with the ways and lands of your people.
data.benefit: When you use bardic performance with audible components underground, the range or area of your chosen performance is doubled, and you can affect deaf creatures if they possess tremorsense and are in your new range. In addition, the DC for saving throws against your bardic performance is increased by +2 for creatures of the earth subtype, regardless of where the performance occurs.

data.name: Stunning Assault
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +16.
data.description: You powerful but imprecise attacks can stun your enemies.
data.benefit: You can choose to take a -5 penalty on all melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to stun targets you hit with your melee attacks for 1 round. A successful Fortitude save negates the effect. The DC of this save is 10 + your base attack bonus. You must choose to use this feat before making the attack roll, and its effects last until your next turn.

data.name: Summoner's Call
data.prerequisites: Eidolon class feature.
data.description: Whenever you summon your eidolon, it is more powerful for a brief period of time.
data.benefit: Whenever you summon your eidolon, you may give it a +2 enhancement bonus to its Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution. This bonus lasts 10 minutes after the summoning ritual is complete.

data.name: Sundering Strike
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Improved Sunder, Power Attack, base attack bonus +9.
data.description: Your critical hits can sunder your foes' weapons.
data.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee attack, you can sunder your opponent's weapon, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the attack. If your confirmation roll exceeds your opponent's CMD, you may deal damage to your opponent's weapon as if from the sunder combat maneuver (roll normal damage to the weapon separately). This does not provoke an attack of opportunity.
data.normal: You must perform a sunder combat maneuver to sunder an opponent's weapon.
data.special: You can only apply the effects of one of the following feats to a given critical hit: Bull Rush Strike, Disarming Strike, Repositioning Strike, Sundering Strike, or Tripping Strike. You may choose to use this feat after you make your confirmation roll.

data.name: Swap Places
data.description: You are skilled at changing places with your ally during a chaotic melee.
data.benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, you can move into your ally's square as part of normal movement. At the same time, your ally moves into your previous space as an immediate action. Both you and your ally must be willing and able to move to take advantage of this feat. Your ally must be the same size as you to utilize this feat. Your ally does not provoke an attack of opportunity from this movement, but you provoke as normal. This movement does not count against your ally's movement on his next turn.

data.name: Swift Aid
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: With a quick but harmless swipe, you can aid an ally's assault.
data.benefit: As a swift action, you can attempt the aid another action, granting your ally either a +1 bonus on his next attack roll or a +1 bonus to his AC.
data.normal: Aid another is a standard action.

data.name: Taunt
data.prerequisites: Cha 13, Small size or smaller.
data.description: You may be small, but your remarks cut others down to size.
data.benefit: You can demoralize opponents using Bluff rather than Intimidate (see the Intimidate skill description for details) and take no skill check penalty for being smaller than your target.

data.name: Team Up
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Gang Up, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: When you are ganging up against an enemy, you can aid an ally with a quick feint.
data.benefit: When you and at least two of your allies are adjacent to an opponent, you can attempt the aid another action as a move action.
data.normal: Aid another is a standard action.

data.name: Teleport Tactician
data.prerequisites: Combat Reflexes, Disruptive, Spellbreaker.
data.description: You are highly alert for enemies using teleportation to approach you or flee from you.
data.benefit: Any creature using a teleportation effect to enter or leave a square threatened by you provokes an attack of opportunity, even if casting defensively or using a supernatural ability.

data.name: Tenacious Transmutation
data.prerequisites: Spell Focus (transmutation).
data.description: Your mastery of the magic of changing makes your transmutations more durable.
data.benefit: The DC of caster level checks to dispel or remove your transmutations increases by 2; even if the spell is negated, its effects persist for 1 additional round before dissipating.

data.name: Thundering Spell
data.description: You can conjure your spells into existence with blaring thunder or fearful shrieks, deafening creatures damaged by their effects.
data.benefit: You can modify a spell to deafen a creature damaged by the spell. When a creature takes damage from this spell, it becomes deafened for a number of rounds equal to the original level of the spell. If the spell allows a saving throw, a successful save negates the deafening effect. If the spell does not allow a save, the target can make a Fortitude save to negate the deafening effect. If the spell effect also causes the creature to become deafened, the duration of this metamagic effect is added to the duration of the spell. A thundering spell uses up a spell slot two levels higher than the spell's actual level. Spells that do not inflict damage do not benefit from this feat.

data.name: Touch of Serenity
data.prerequisites: Wis 18, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8.
data.description: With a single touch you can reduce the threat of even the most savage of foes.
data.benefit: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your attack roll (thus a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). On a successful hit, the attack deals no damage and bestows no other effect or condition, but the target cannot cast spells or attack (including attacks of opportunity and attacks as immediate actions) for 1 round unless it succeeds on a Will saving throw with a DC of 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wisdom modifier. You may attempt a touch of serenity once per day for every four levels you have attained (but see Special), and no more than once per round.
data.special: A monk of the lotus receives Touch of Serenity as a bonus feat at 1st level, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. A monk may attempt a touch of serenity a number of times per day equal to his monk level, plus one more time per day for every four levels he has in classes other than monk.

data.name: Trick Riding
data.prerequisites: Ride 9 ranks, Mounted Combat.
data.description: You are not only skilled at controlling a horse in combat; you can make it look like art.
data.benefit: While wearing light or no armor, you do not need to make Ride skill checks for any task listed in the Ride skill with a DC of 15 or lower. You do not take a -5 penalty for riding a mount bareback. You can make a check using Mounted Combat to negate a hit on your mount twice per round instead of just once.

data.name: Tripping Strike
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, base attack bonus +9.
data.description: The force intrinsic to your critical hits can knock your foes down.
data.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee attack, you can trip your opponent, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the attack. If your confirmation roll exceeds your opponent's CMD, you may knock your opponent prone as if from the trip combat maneuver. This does not provoke an attack of opportunity. If you are tripped during your own trip attempt, you can drop your weapon to avoid being tripped.
data.normal: You must perform a trip combat maneuver to trip an opponent.
data.special: You can only apply the effects of one of the following feats to a given critical hit: Bull Rush Strike, Disarming Strike, Repositioning Strike, Sundering Strike, or Tripping Strike. You may choose to use this feat after you make your confirmation roll.

data.name: Under and Over
data.prerequisites: Agile Maneuvers, Small size or smaller.
data.description: You can slip under a foe trying to grab you, knocking him off balance.
data.benefit: If an opponent larger than you attempts to grapple you and fails, you may make a trip attack as an immediate action against that opponent with a +2 bonus. This does not provoke an attack of opportunity.

data.name: Underfoot
data.prerequisites: Dodge, Mobility, Small size or smaller.
data.description: You slip under and around your larger foes.
data.benefit: You receive a +4 dodge bonus on Acrobatics checks to move past opponents without provoking attacks of opportunity, so long as they are larger than you. In addition, you gain a +2 dodge bonus to Armor Class against attacks of opportunity caused when you move out of or within a larger opponent's threatened area (this stacks with the +4 bonus provided by Mobility, for a total bonus of +6).

data.name: Vermin Heart
data.prerequisites: Wild empathy class feature.
data.description: You have a special bond with things that creep, crawl, skitter, and sting.
data.benefit: You may target vermin with spells and special abilities that only affect animals (although they are still affected by spells targeting vermin as well). You may use wild empathy to inf luence vermin as easily as you inf luence animals.

data.name: War Singer
data.prerequisites: Cha 13, bardic performance class feature, half-orc or orc.
data.description: Your songs draw upon the savage chants and brutal ways of your people, inspiring those around you to new heights of violence and savagery.
data.benefit: When you use bardic performance with audible components on a battlefield (any area where a combat involving a dozen or more combatants is taking place), the range or area of your chosen performance is doubled. In addition, the DC for saving throws against your bardic performance is increased by +2 for creatures of the orc subtype, regardless of where the performance occurs.

data.name: Well-Prepared
data.prerequisites: Halfling.
data.description: Somehow, you always seem to have the right tools or supplies close at hand.
data.benefit: Once per day, when confronted with a situation that calls for a particular mundane item of equipment, you may make a Sleight of Hand check with a DC of 10 plus the item's cost in gold pieces to "happen" to have such an item on your person. For example, having a crowbar would be DC 12, whereas a flask of acid would be DC 20. The item must be something you can easily carry-if you are on foot and have only a backpack, for example, you could not have a large iron cauldron. You cannot have magical items using this feat, nor can you have specif ic items, such as the key to a particular door. If you are stripped of your equipment or possessions, you lose the benef its of this feat until you have at least a day to resupply and "acquire" new items. You must pay for these items normally.
data.special: At the GM's option, a character can substitute the Survival skill for Sleight of Hand with this feat. Such a choice is permanent.

data.name: Adder Strike
data.prerequisites: Poison use class feature, Craft (alchemy) 1 rank, Improved Unarmed Strike.
data.description: You can quickly apply poison to gloved hands, protected feet, or other protected body parts, delivering the poison with your unarmed strikes.
data.benefit: As a swift action, you can apply one dose of contact or injury poison to two body parts that you use for unarmed strikes. You must still protect yourself against exposure to contact poisons you apply in this way.
data.normal: Applying poison to a weapon or single piece of ammunition is a standard action.

data.name: Adept Champion
data.prerequisites: Smite evil class feature, base attack bonus +5.
data.description: You can alter your smite ability, channeling the power of your deity into divine inspiration that grants you greater aptitude for performing combat maneuvers.
data.benefit: While using your smite evil class feature, as a swift action at the start of your turn, you can forgo the bonus on damage rolls and instead gain half that bonus as a bonus on combat maneuver checks against the target of your smite. The effects of your smite evil feature return to normal at the start of your next turn.

data.name: Amateur Gunslinger
data.prerequisites: You have no levels in a class that has the grit class feature.
data.description: Although you are not a gunslinger, you have and can use grit.
data.benefit: You gain a small amount of grit and the ability to perform a single 1st-level deed from the gunslinger deed class feature. At the start of the day, you gain 1 grit point, though throughout the day you can gain grit points up to a maximum of your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1). You can regain grit using the rules for the gunslinger's grit class feature (see page 9). You can spend this grit to perform the 1st-level deed you chose upon taking this feat, and any other deed you have gained through feats or magic items.
data.special: If you gain levels in a class that grants the grit class feature, you can immediately trade this feat for the Extra Grit feat.

data.name: Arc Slinger
data.prerequisites: Point-Blank Shot, proficient with sling or halfling sling staff.
data.description: You can twirl your sling in a way that maximizes its effectiveness.
data.benefit: When using a sling or sling staff, you reduce your penalty on ranged attack rolls due to range by 2. Point-Blank Shot's damage bonus applies within the first normal range increment of your sling (50 feet) or sling staff (80 feet).

data.name: Back to Back
data.prerequisites: Perception 3 ranks.
data.description: Your ally's eyes are your own, and yours are his.
data.benefit: While you are flanked and adjacent to an ally with this feat, you receive a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against attacks from opponents flanking you.

data.name: Betrayer
data.prerequisites: Quick Draw, Persuasive, base attack bonus +3.
data.description: You can charm people into lowering their defenses, allowing you to ambush them more effectively.
data.benefit: When you succeed at a Diplomacy check to change a creature's attitude, you can draw a weapon and make a single melee attack against that creature as an immediate action. If you changed your target's attitude to friendly or better, your target is considered flat-footed against this attack. If the target survives, it takes a -2 penalty on its initiative check for this combat. Once you attack a creature, its attitude becomes hostile.

data.name: Binding Throw
data.prerequisites: Improved Grapple, Improved Trip, Improved Unarmed Strike, Ki Throw.
data.description: You can strike your enemy and use the blow as an opportunity to grab and hold him.
data.benefit: After you successfully use the Ki Throw feat on an opponent, you can use a swift action to attempt a grapple combat maneuver against that opponent.
data.normal: The grapple combat maneuver is a standard action.
data.special: A monk can gain Binding Throw as a bonus feat starting at 14th level.

data.name: Bludgeoner
data.description: You can knock foes out cold with just about any blunt instrument.
data.benefit: You take no penalty on attack rolls for using a lethal bludgeoning weapon to deal nonlethal damage.
data.normal: You take a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a lethal weapon to deal nonlethal damage. You cannot use a lethal weapon to deal nonlethal damage in a sneak attack.
data.special: A rogue with this feat can use a lethal bludgeoning weapon to deal nonlethal damage with a sneak attack.

data.name: Boar Ferocity
data.prerequisites: Improved Unarmed Strike, Boar Style, Intimidate 6 ranks.
data.description: Your flesh-ripping unarmed strikes terrify your victims.
data.benefit: You add piercing damage to the damage types you can deal with your unarmed strikes. Further, you gain a +2 bonus on Intimidate checks to demoralize opponents. While using Boar Style, whenever you tear an opponent's f lesh, you can spend a free action to make an Intimidate check to demoralize that opponent.

data.name: Boar Shred
data.prerequisites: Improved Unarmed Strike, Boar Ferocity, Boar Style, Intimidate 9 ranks.
data.description: The wounds you inflict with your unarmed strikes bleed, giving you renewed vigor.
data.benefit: You can make an Intimidate check to demoralize an opponent as a move action. While using Boar Style, whenever you tear an opponent's flesh, once per round at the start of that opponent's turn he takes 1d6 bleed damage. The bleed damage dealt while using Boar Style persist even if you later switch to a different style.

data.name: Boar Style
data.prerequisites: Improved Unarmed Strike, Intimidate 3 ranks.
data.description: Your sharp teeth and nails rip your foes open.
data.benefit: You can deal bludgeoning damage or slashing damage with your unarmed strikes-changing damage type is a free action. While using this style, once per round when you hit a single foe with two or more unarmed strikes, you can tear flesh. When you do, you deal 2d6 extra points of damage with the attack.

data.name: Body Shield
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: With a sly maneuver, you force a grappled opponent into the path of an incoming attack.
data.benefit: As an immediate action while you are grappling an adjacent creature, you can make a grapple combat maneuver check against that creature to gain cover against a single attack. If you are successful and the attack misses you, that attack targets the creature you used as cover, using the same attack roll. You cannot use this feat against a creature grappling you, and the cover you gain ends after the attack you gained cover against is resolved.

data.name: Bolstered Resilience
data.prerequisites: Damage reduction.
data.description: You can dramatically increase your damage reduction in exchange for its temporary loss.
data.benefit: As an immediate action, you can double your DR against a single attack, to a maximum of DR 20. The type of the DR remains unchanged. If the attack you are guarding against is not successful, the increased damage reduction persists until you are hit with an attack or until the start of your next turn, whichever happens first. At the start of your next turn, you become fatigued. You cannot use this feat while you are fatigued.

data.name: Bonebreaker
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, Jawbreaker, Stunning Fist, Heal 9 ranks.
data.description: When your opponent is unable to adequately defend against them, your precise unarmed strikes break bone and tear tissue.
data.benefit: When you make a successful Stunning Fist attempt against an opponent that is grappled, helpless, or stunned, you can forgo any other Stunning Fist effect to deal 1d6 Strength or Dexterity damage to that opponent.

data.name: Branded for Retribution
data.prerequisites: Bane class feature.
data.description: You brand an enemy with your bane weapon, making it more vulnerable to your allies' attacks.
data.benefit: As a standard action, expend 3 rounds of your bane class feature and make a melee touch attack with the weapon affected by bane. If you hit, your target takes no damage but is branded until the start of your next turn. While this brand remains, your allies' weapons are considered to have the bane ability with which your weapon is imbued when they attack the branded creature.

data.name: Break Guard
data.prerequisites: Dex 15, Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Disarm, Two-Weapon Fighting.
data.description: You can use one of your two weapons to occupy your opponent's defenses while attacking with the other.
data.benefit: While wielding two weapons, whenever you successfully use one weapon to disarm an opponent, you can spend a swift action to attack the opponent you attempted to disarm using your other weapon.

data.name: Broken Wing Gambit
data.prerequisites: Bluff 5 ranks.
data.description: You feign weakness, making yourself a tempting and distracting target.
data.benefit: Whenever you make a melee attack and hit your opponent, you can use a free action to grant that opponent a +2 bonus on attack and damage rolls against you until the end of your next turn or until your opponent attacks you, whichever happens first. If that opponent attacks you with this bonus, it provokes attacks of opportunity from your allies who have this feat.

data.name: Cartwheel Dodge
data.prerequisites: Evasion class feature, improved evasion class feature, acrobatics 12 ranks.
data.description: You use your knack for avoiding damage to reposition yourself in combat.
data.benefit: When you successfully use improved evasion to avoid taking damage, you can move up to half your speed as an immediate action. This movement provokes attacks of opportunity as normal.

data.name: Cavalry Formation
data.prerequisites: Mounted Combat.
data.description: You are skilled at riding in close formation with your mounted allies without impeding your effectiveness on the battlefield.
data.benefit: You and your mount can overlap the space of mounts whose riders have this feat, although no more than two creatures can share any one square. Further, you can charge through a space containing an allied mount if that mount's rider has this feat, although the space from which you make your charge attack must comply with this feat's other benefit or be unoccupied.

data.name: Channeled Revival
data.prerequisites: Channel energy 6d6 (positive energy).
data.description: You can expend a large portion of your channeling power to reverse death itself.
data.benefit: As a full-round action that provokes attacks of opportunity, you can expend three uses of your channel energy class feature to restore a dead creature to life as if you had cast the breath of life spell (Core Rulebook 251).

data.name: Channeling Scourge
data.prerequisites: Channel energy class feature, inquisitor level 1st.
data.description: Your zeal for hunting your faith's enemies empowers your ability to channel divine energy, as long as you channel that energy for harm.
data.benefit: When you use channel energy to deal damage, your inquisitor levels count as cleric levels for determining the number of damage dice and the saving throw DC.

data.name: Charging Hurler
data.prerequisites: Point-Blank Shot.
data.description: You know how to use your momentum to enhance your thrown weapon attacks.
data.benefit: You can use the charge rules to make a thrown weapon attack. All the parameters of a charge apply, except that you must only move closer to your opponent, and you must end your movement within 30 feet of that opponent. If you do, you can make a single thrown weapon attack against that opponent, gaining the +2 bonus on the attack roll and taking a -2 penalty to your AC until the start of your next turn.

data.name: Chokehold
data.prerequisites: Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +6 or monk level 5th.
data.description: While grappling, you can cut off an opponent's air and blood supply.
data.benefit: While you have an opponent up to one size category larger than you grappled, you can attempt a grapple combat maneuver with a -5 penalty on the check. If you succeed, you have pinned your opponent and hold the opponent in a chokehold. When you maintain the grapple, you also maintain the chokehold. A creature in a chokehold cannot breathe or speak, and thus cannot cast spells that have a verbal component. An opponent you have in a chokehold has to hold his breath or begin suffocating. Any creature that does not breathe, is immune to bleed damage, or is immune to critical hits is immune to the effects of your chokehold. When the grapple is ended, so is the chokehold.

data.name: Cleaving Finish
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Cleave, Power Attack.
data.description: When you strike down an opponent, you can continue your swing into another target.
data.benefit: If you make a melee attack, and your target drops to 0 or fewer hit points as a result of your attack, you can make another melee attack using your highest base attack bonus against another opponent within reach. You can make only one extra attack per round with this feat.

data.name: Close-Quarters Thrower
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Dodge, Weapon Focus with selected thrown weapon.
data.description: You are agile enough to avoid melee attacks while throwing weapons or bombs.
data.benefit: Choose a type of thrown weapon. You do not provoke attacks of opportunity for making ranged attacks using the selected weapon. If you are an alchemist, and you select this feat and choose alchemist bombs, you do not provoke attacks of opportunity for the process of drawing components of, creating, and throwing a bomb.
data.normal: Making a ranged attack provokes attacks of opportunity.

data.name: Clustered Shots
data.prerequisites: Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: You take a moment to carefully aim your shots, causing them all to strike nearly the same spot.
data.benefit: When you use a full-attack action to make multiple ranged weapon attacks against the same opponent, total the damage from all hits before applying that opponent's damage reduction.
data.special: If the massive damage optional rule is being used (Core Rulebook 189), that rule applies if the total damage you deal with this feat is equal to or exceeds half the opponent's full normal hit points (minimum 50 points of damage).

data.name: Combat Medic
data.prerequisites: Heal 5 ranks.
data.description: You know the urgency of treating wounds in the heat of battle, applying first aid to your allies with such speed that you assure no one gets left behind.
data.benefit: Whenever you use Heal to provide first aid, treat caltrop wounds, or treat poison on an ally who also has this feat, you provoke no attacks of opportunity, and can take 10 on the check. Unlike with other teamwork feats, allies that are paralyzed, stunned, unconscious, or cannot otherwise act still count for the purposes of this feet.

data.name: Combat Style Master
data.prerequisites: Improved Unarmed Strike, two or more style feats, base attack bonus +6 or monk level 5th.
data.description: You shift between combat styles, combining them to increased effect.
data.benefit: You can switch your style as a free action. At the start of combat, pick one of your styles. You start the combat in that style, even in the surprise round.
data.normal: It takes a swift action to begin or switch your styles.

data.name: Contingent Channeling
data.prerequisites: True healer class feature, Selective Channeling.
data.description: You can imbue others with your healing energy so that they can use it at the moment of greatest need.
data.benefit: You can use a standard action to touch an ally and expend one of your daily uses of channel energy to create a repository of positive energy within that ally. This repository contains the same number and type of dice as normal for your channel energy feature, and it lasts for 1 minute. An ally who has such a repository can use an immediate action to roll the repository's dice and regain a number of hit points equal to the result. If an ally who has such a repository is reduced to negative hit points, the repository triggers, allowing the ally to heal without using an action.

data.name: Coordinated Charge
data.prerequisites: You have at least two other teamwork feats, base attack bonus +10.
data.description: You are an expert at leading your allies into the fray.
data.benefit: When an ally with this feat charges a creature that is no further away from you than your speed, you can, as an immediate action, charge that creature. You must be able to follow all of the normal charge rules.

data.name: Crane Riposte
data.prerequisites: Crane Style, Crane Wing, Dodge, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8 or monk level 7th.
data.description: You use your defensive abilities to make overpowering counterattacks.
data.benefit: You take only a -1 penalty on attack rolls for fighting defensively. Whenever you deflect an opponent's attack using Crane Wing or lose the doge bonus from Crane Wing because an attack missed you by 4 or less, you can make an attack of opportunity against the attacker after the attack misses.

data.name: Crane Style
data.prerequisites: Dodge, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +2 or monk level 1st.
data.description: Your unarmed fighting techniques blend poise with graceful defense.
data.benefit: You take only a -2 penalty on attack rolls for f ighting defensively. While using this style and fighting defensively or using the total defense action, you gain an additional +1 dodge bonus to your Armor Class.

data.name: Crane Wing
data.prerequisites: Crane Style, Dodge, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +5 or monk level 5th.
data.description: You move with the speed and finesse of an avian hunter, your sweeping blocks and graceful motions allowing you to deflect melee attacks with ease.
data.benefit: When fighting defensively with at least one hand free, you gain a +4 dodge bonus to AC against melee attacks.  If a melee attack misses you by 4 or less, you lose this dodge bonus until the beginning of your next turn. If you are using the total defense action instead, you can deflect one melee attack that would normally hit you. An attack so deflected deals no damage and has no other effect (instead treat it as a miss). You do not expend an action when using this feat, but you must be aware of the attack and not flat-footed.

data.name: Crusader's Fist
data.prerequisites: Lay on hands class feature or touch of corruption class feature, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: You pour divine energy into the enemy you strike.
data.benefit: When you attack with an unarmed strike and hit a creature that you can harm with your lay on hands or touch of corruption feature, you can use a swift action to expend a daily use of that feature to deal its normal damage as if you had hit with the feature's normal touch attack. This extra damage is not multiplied if you scored a critical hit.

data.name: Crusader's Flurry
data.prerequisites: Channel energy class feature, flurry of blows class feature, Weapon Focus with your deity's favored melee weapon.
data.description: You learned to use your deity's favored weapon as part of your martial arts form.
data.benefit: You can use your deity's favored weapon as if it were a monk weapon.

data.name: Crushing Blow
data.prerequisites: Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist.
data.description: Your focus allows you to smash your enemy's defenses.
data.benefit: You can make a Stunning Fist attempt as a full-round action. If successful, instead of stunning your target, you reduce the target's AC by an amount equal to your Wisdom modifier for 1 minute. This penalty does not stack with other penalties applied due to Crushing Blow.

data.name: Deadly Finish
data.prerequisites: Base attack bonus +11.
data.description: Your attacks don't just fell your opponents-they kill them outright.
data.benefit: When you hit with a melee attack and reduce your opponent to -1 or fewer hit points, you can force that opponent to succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15 + the damage your attack dealt) or die.

data.name: Death from Above
data.description: You allow gravity to add extra force to your charges.
data.benefit: Whenever you charge an opponent from higher ground, or from above while flying, you gain a +5 bonus on attack rolls in place of the bonuses from charging and being on higher ground.

data.name: Death or Glory
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: Even when facing a larger foe, you aren't afraid to take great risks in order to finish the fight.
data.benefit: Against a creature of size Large or larger, you can make a single melee attack as a full-round action, gaining a +4 bonus on the attack roll, damage roll, and critical confirmation roll. You gain an additional +1 on this bonus at base attack bonus +11, +16, and +20 (for a maximum of +7 at base attack +20). After you resolve your attack, the opponent you attack can spend an immediate action to make a single melee attack against you with the same bonuses.
data.special: You can combine the full-round action attack this feat allows with the benefit of Vital Strike, Improved Vital Strike, or Greater Vital Strike.

data.name: Deathless Initiate
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Con 13, orc or half-orc, Diehard, Endurance, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: For you, impending death is a call to wrath.
data.benefit: You are not staggered while using the Diehard feat, but if you take a move and a standard action or a fullround action while you are at 0 or fewer hit points you take 1 point of damage. Further, while using the Diehard feat, you gain a +2 bonus on melee attacks and damage rolls.

data.name: Deathless Master
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Con 15, orc or half-orc, Deathless Initiate, Diehard, Endurance, Ironhide**, base attack bonus +9.
data.description: Even if you suffer a grievous wound, you can shrug off the damage and continue your relentless assault.
data.benefit: When you are at 0 or fewer hit points, you do not lose 1 hit point when you take an action.

data.name: Deathless Zealot
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Con 17, orc or half-orc, Deathless Initiate, Deathless Master, Diehard, Endurance, Ironhide**, base attack bonus +12.
data.description: Only the most serious wounds can stop you.
data.benefit: Whenever a creature rolls to confirm a critical hit against you, it must roll twice and take the lowest result.

data.name: Deceptive Exchange
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Feint.
data.description: You trick an adversary into grabbing an object you hand them, even in the midst of combat.
data.benefit: If you successfully feint an opponent, you can trick that opponent into accepting a one-handed object you are holding instead of denying that opponent its Dexterity bonus to AC against your next attack. The opponent must have appendages capable of holding the object you offer, and it must have one such appendage free to take the object.
data.special: An alchemist who has the delayed bomb alchemist discovery can use this feat to hand an enemy a delayed bomb. Such a delayed bomb detonates at the end of the alchemist's turn. If the bomb is in a creature's square at the end of the alchemist's turn, the bomb deals that creature a direct hit.

data.name: Defensive Weapon Training
data.prerequisites: Int 13, base attack bonus +5.
data.description: You know how to defend yourself against a certain class of weaponry.
data.benefit: Choose a weapon group from the fighter's weapon training class ability list (except natural weapons). You gain a +2 dodge bonus on AC when an opponent attacks you using a weapon from that group. If you also have the weapon training class feature in the selected group, your dodge bonus from this feat increases to +3.
data.special: You can select this feat more than once. Its effects do not stack. Each time you select this feat, it applies to a different weapon group.

data.name: Deft Shootist Deed
data.prerequisites: Grit class feature or Amateur Gunslinger feat, Dodge, Mobility.
data.description: You keep an eye out while focusing on your weapon, allowing you to avoid attacks while shooting and reloading firearms.
data.benefit: As long as you have at least 1 grit point, you do not provoke attacks of opportunity when shooting or reloading a firearm.

data.name: Destructive Dispel
data.prerequisites: Ability to cast dispel magic or greater dispel magic, caster level 11th.
data.description: When you dispel an enemy's magical defenses, those defenses crash down with debilitating effects.
data.benefit: When you successfully make a targeted dispel check against an opponent, that opponent must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC equals the DC of the spell used to dispel) or be stunned until the start of your next turn. If the save succeeds, the opponent is instead sickened until the start of your next turn.

data.name: Devastating Strike
data.prerequisites: Vital Strike, base attack bonus +9.
data.description: Pitting all of your strength and resolve against your enemy, you deliver a strike that is impossible to ignore.
data.benefit: Whenever you use Vital Strike, Improved Vital Strike, or Greater Vital Strike, you gain a +2 bonus on each extra weapon damage dice roll those feats grant (+6 maximum). This bonus damage is multiplied on a critical hit.

data.name: Dimensional Agility
data.prerequisites: Ability to use the abundant step class feature or cast dimension door.
data.description: Teleportation does not faze you.
data.benefit: After using abundant step or casting dimension door, you can take any actions you still have remaining on your turn. You also gain a +4 bonus on Concentration checks when casting teleportation spells.

data.name: Dimensional Assault
data.prerequisites: Ability to use the abundant step class feature or cast dimension door, Dimensional Agility.
data.description: You have been trained to use magical movement as part of your combat tactics.
data.benefit: As a full-round action, you use abundant step or cast dimension door as a special charge. Doing so allows you to teleport up to double your current speed (up to the maximum distance allowed by the spell or ability) and to make the attack normally allowed on a charge.

data.name: Dimensional Dervish
data.prerequisites: Ability to use the abundant step class feature or cast dimension door, Dimensional Agility, Dimensional Assault, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: You teleport with a mere thought, savaging your opponents as you flash in and out of reality.
data.benefit: You can take a full-attack action, activating abundant step or casting dimension door as a swift action. If your do, you can teleport up to twice your speed (up to the maximum distance allowed by the spell or ability), dividing this teleportation into increments you use before your first attack, between each attack, and after your last attack. You must teleport at least 5 feet each time you teleport.
data.special: A monk can use additional points from his ki pool to increase his speed before determining the total speed for this teleportation.

data.name: Dimensional Maneuvers
data.prerequisites: Ability to use the abundant step class feature or cast dimension door, Dimensional Agility, Dimensional Assault, Dimensional Dervish, base attack bonus +9.
data.description: Your rapid teleportation makes your combat maneuvers more difficult to avoid.
data.benefit: While using the Dimensional Dervish feat, you gain a +4 bonus on combat maneuver checks to bull rush, disarm, reposition, or trip an opponent.

data.name: Dimensional Savant
data.prerequisites: Dimensional Agility, Dimensional Assault, Dimensional Dervish, ability to use the abundant step class feature or cast dimension door, base attack bonus +9.
data.description: You flash into and out of reality so quickly it is impossible to tell exactly where you are at any given time.
data.benefit: While using the Dimensional Dervish feat, you provide flanking from all squares you attack from. Flanking starts from the moment you make an attack until the start of your next turn. You can effectively flank with yourself and with multiple allies when using this feat.

data.name: Discordant Voice
data.prerequisites: Bardic performance class feature, Perform (oratory or sing) 10 ranks.
data.description: By singing out a precise tone, you cause discordant vibrations to run through allies' weapons.
data.benefit: Whenever you are using bardic performance to create a spell-like or supernatural effect, allies within 30 feet of you deal an extra 1d6 points of sonic damage with successful weapon attacks. This damage stacks with other energy damage a weapon might deal. Projectile weapons bestow this extra damage on their ammunition, but the extra damage is dealt only if the projectile hits a target within 30 feet of you.

data.name: Disengaging Feint
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Feint.
data.description: You can feint to disengage from combat.
data.benefit: As a standard action, use Bluff to feint against an opponent. Instead of denying that opponent his Dexterity bonus to AC, a successful feint allows you to move up to your speed without provoking an attack of opportunity from the opponent you feinted for leaving the square you start in.

data.name: Disengaging Flourish
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Disengaging Feint, Improved Feint.
data.description: Distracting your opponents gives you the opportunity to make a swift retreat.
data.benefit: As a standard action, make a Bluff check against each opponent that currently threatens you. If you succeed against at least one opponent, you can move up to your speed. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity from any opponent you succeeded at feinting against.

data.name: Disengaging Shot
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Disengaging Feint, Dodge, Improved Feint, Mobility.
data.description: You make one last attack before beating a hasty retreat.
data.benefit: Whenever you use Disengaging Feint or Disengaging Flourish, you can make a single melee attack against one opponent you succeeded at feinting against. That opponent is denied his Dexterity bonus to AC against this attack.

data.name: Disorienting Maneuver
data.prerequisites: Dodge, Acrobatics 5 ranks.
data.description: Your erratic movements disorient your opponent.
data.benefit: If you successfully use Acrobatics to tumble through an opponent's space, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus on attack rolls against that opponent until the start of your next turn. If you choose to make a trip attempt against that opponent, you gain a +4 circumstance bonus on your combat maneuver check. This bonus on trip also lasts until the start of your next turn.

data.name: Dispel Synergy
data.prerequisites: Spellcraft 5 ranks.
data.description: By tearing away an opponent's magical defenses, you leave your enemy vulnerable, making it difficult for him to resist your spells.
data.benefit: If you successfully dispel an ongoing magical effect on an opponent, that opponent takes a -2 penalty on saving throws against your spells until the end of your next turn.

data.name: Dispelling Critical
data.prerequisites: Arcane Strike, base attack bonus +11, ability to cast dispel magic.
data.description: Your blows attack the physical and arcane forms of your enemies at the same time.
data.benefit: If you have dispel magic prepared or can cast it spontaneously, when you score a critical hit against an opponent, you may use a swift action to cast dispel magic to make a targeted dispel against that opponent.

data.name: Dispelling Fist
data.prerequisites: Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +11, ability to cast dispel magic, caster level 7th.
data.description: By focusing on your knowledge of magic and spells that negate its powers, you use your bare hands to rip magical defenses from your enemy.
data.benefit: If you have dispel magic prepared or can cast it spontaneously, you can cast it as a swift action after hitting an opponent with an unarmed strike. Treat this as a targeted dispel against the opponent you hit.

data.name: Disposable Weapon
data.prerequisites: Base attack bonus +1, proficient with weapon.
data.description: You ignore the limitations of your equipment, striking harder despite the damage it does to your weapon.
data.benefit: Whenever you use a melee or thrown weapon with the fragile weapon special quality to score a critical threat against an opponent, you can give your weapon the broken condition to automatically conf irm the critical hit.

data.name: Disruptive Recall
data.prerequisites: Spell recall class feature, Spellcraft 5 ranks.
data.description: You can disrupt an enemy caster's spells to fuel your own arcane power.
data.benefit: When you use a melee attack to successfully disrupt an arcane spellcaster's spell, you can immediately use your spell recall class feature to regain a magus spell you have already cast. This ability functions as if you had expended a number of points from your arcane pool equal to the level of the spell you disrupted, up to the maximum level spell you can cast.

data.name: Distance Thrower
data.prerequisites: Str 13.
data.description: You are accurate with thrown weapons at longer ranges than normal.
data.benefit: With a thrown weapon, you reduce your penalty on ranged attack rolls due to range by 2.

data.name: Djinni Spin
data.prerequisites: Con 15, Wis 17, Djinni Style, Djinni Spirit, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +13 or monk level 11th.
data.description: You can surround yourself with the power of the storm, spinning like a hurricane to unleash a violent blast of electrical energy.
data.benefit: While using Djinni Style, as a standard action you can spend two Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempts to surround yourself with a whirlwind of electrified air. Creatures adjacent to you take your unarmed strike damage plus the electricity damage from your Elemental Fist and are deafened for 1d4 rounds. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wis modifier) reduces the damage by half and prevents a target from being deafened.

data.name: Djinni Spirit
data.prerequisites: Con 15, Wis 15, Djinni Style, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +11 or monk level 9th.
data.description: By calling upon the spirits of storms, you can manipulate lightning to protect yourself and buffet your enemies with peals of thunder.
data.benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempt per day. While using Djinni Style, you gain electricity resistance equal to your base attack bonus or monk level, whichever is higher. While denied your Dexterity bonus to AC you are also denied this resistance. Creatures that take electricity damage from your Elemental Fist attack must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wis modifier) or be deafened for 1d4 rounds. Those who take damage from your Djinni Spin are deafened, even on a successful saving throw.

data.name: Djinni Style
data.prerequisites: Con 13, Wis 15, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +9 or monk level 5th.
data.description: Your hands sheathed in an auras of lightning, you move like the wind.
data.benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempt per day. While you are in this style you must use Elemental Fist to deal electricity damage and you gain a bonus on electricity damage rolls equal to your Wisdom bonus. Further, while you are using this style and have remaining Elemental Fist attempts, you also gain a +2 dodge bonus to Armor Class against attacks of opportunity. A condition that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to AC also makes you lose this dodge bonus.

data.name: Domain Strike
data.prerequisites: Domain class feature, Improved Unarmed Strike.
data.description: You unleash a domain power upon your enemy as part of your unarmed strike.
data.benefit: When you gain this feat, choose one domaingranted power that you can use to affect no more than one opponent. If you make a successful unarmed strike against an opponent, in addition to dealing your unarmed strike damage, you can use a swift action to deliver the effects of the chosen granted power to that opponent. Doing so provokes no attacks of opportunity.
data.special: You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you take it, you apply it to a different qualifying domain power.

data.name: Double Bane
data.prerequisites: Bane class feature, Two-Weapon Fighting.
data.description: You extend your bane effect to two weapons.
data.benefit: You can apply your bane to a second weapon you are wielding. While your bane class feature is active, at the start of each of your turns as a free action, you choose whether to apply the ability to one weapon or the other, or both. For each round you apply your bane class feature to two weapons, you expend 2 rounds of that feature.

data.name: Drag Down
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Trip.
data.description: When you are knocked prone, you are skilled at bringing your opponent down with you.
data.benefit: Whenever an opponent successfully trips you, you can attempt to trip that opponent as an immediate action.

data.name: Dragon Ferocity
data.prerequisites: Str 15, Improved Unarmed Strike, Dragon Style, Stunning Fist, Acrobatics 5 ranks.
data.description: You attack with the strength of a dragon, your telling blows striking fear into your enemies.
data.benefit: While using Dragon Style, increase your Strength bonus on unarmed strike damage rolls by an additional one-half your Strength bonus, to a total of double your Strength bonus on the first attack and 1-1/2 times your Strength bonus on the other attacks. When you score a critical hit or a successful Stunning Fist attempt against an opponent while using this style, that opponent is also shaken for a number of rounds equal to 1d4 + your Strength bonus.
data.special: Taking this feat allows you to qualify for the Elemental Fist feat (Advanced Player's Guide 158) even if you do not meet that feat's prerequisites. If you do not meet that feat's prerequisites, you must choose one of the damage types that feat offers, and you can use only that damage type with your Elemental Fist attacks until you meet the feat's normal prerequisites. A monk with this feat can  use Elemental Fist as if he were a monk of the four winds (Advanced Player's Guide 112).

data.name: Dragon Roar
data.prerequisites: Str 15, Improved Unarmed Strike, Dragon Style, Stunning Fist, Acrobatics 8 ranks.
data.description: The spirit of the dragon wells up inside you and bursts forth in a mighty roar.
data.benefit: You gain one additional Stunning Fist attempt per day. While using Dragon Style, as a standard action you can expend two Stunning Fist attempts to unleash a concussive roar in a 15-foot cone. Creatures caught in the cone take your unarmed strike damage and become shaken for 1d4 rounds. A successful Will save (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wis modifier) reduces the damage by half and prevents a target from being shaken.
data.special: If you have the Elemental Fist feat (Advanced Player's Guide 158), you can expend a daily use of that feat to deal your Elemental Fist damage to those caught in the cone. This damage is not halved even on a save.

data.name: Dragon Style
data.prerequisites: Str 15, Improved Unarmed Strike, Acrobatics 3 ranks.
data.description: You call upon the spirit of dragonkind, gaining greater resilience, mobility, and fierceness from the blessing of these great beings.
data.benefit: While using this style, you gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against sleep effects, paralysis effects, and stunning effects. You ignore difficult terrain when you charge, run, or withdraw. You can also charge through squares that contain allies. Further, you can add 1-1/2 times your Strength bonus on the damage roll for your first unarmed strike on a given round.
data.normal: You cannot charge or run through difficult terrain, and you cannot charge through a square that contains an ally. With an unarmed strike, you usually add your Strength bonus on damage rolls.

data.name: Dramatic Display
data.prerequisites: Dazzling Display.
data.description: Your skill with your weapon is obvious to enemies and onlookers alike.
data.benefit: When you spend a swift action to make a performance check, you exude an aura of awe-inspiring skill. You gain a +2 bonus on your performance check, and gain a +2 bonus on all attack rolls and combat maneuver checks until the end of your next turn.

data.name: Earth Child Binder
data.prerequisites: Wis 13, dwarf or gnome, defensive training racial trait, Earth Child Style, Earth Child Topple, Greater Trip, Improved Trip, Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist, Acrobatics 9 ranks.
data.description: Even the greatest giants fear your technique.
data.benefit: You can trip a creature of the giant subtype no matter its size. While you are using Earth Child Style, when a prone creature of the giant subtype stands up and provokes an attack of opportunity from you, if you make an unarmed strike, you can declare you are making a Stunning Fist attempt after the attack hits. You gain a +4 bonus to the DC of any Stunning Fist effect you deliver in this way.
data.normal: You can only trip opponents who are one size category larger than you.

data.name: Earth Child Style
data.prerequisites: Wis 13, dwarf or gnome, defensive training racial trait, Improved Unarmed Strike, Acrobatics 3 ranks.
data.description: Your martial training makes you a dangerous and elusive target for giants.
data.benefit: While using this style, your defensive training dodge bonus to AC increases to +6. Further, against creatures of the giant subtype, you can add your Wisdom bonus on your unarmed strike damage rolls.

data.name: Earth Child Topple
data.prerequisites: Wis 13, dwarf or gnome, defensive training racial trait, Earth Child Style, Improved Trip, Improved Unarmed Strike, Acrobatics 6 ranks.
data.description: Your mastery of balance and momentum allows you to bring down giants with your bare hands.
data.benefit: You can trip a creature of the giant subtype of up to Huge size. While using Earth Child Style, you add your Wisdom bonus on combat maneuver checks made to trip a creature of the giant subtype, as well as on attack rolls to confirm a critical hit against such a creature.
data.normal: You can trip only those opponents that are one size category larger than you.

data.name: Efreeti Stance
data.prerequisites: Con 15, Wis 15, Efreeti Style, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +11 or monk level 9th.
data.description: Calling upon the burning spirits of incarnate flame, you can manipulate fire to protect yourself and immolate your foes.
data.benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempt per day. While using Efreeti Style, you gain fire resistance equal to your base attack bonus or your monk level plus any base attack bonus gained from levels in classes other than monk, whichever is higher. While denied your Dexterity bonus to AC you are also denied this resistance. Creatures that take fire damage from your Elemental Fist attack must succeed at a Ref lex save (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wis modifier) or catch on fire.

data.name: Efreeti Style
data.prerequisites: Con 13, Wis 15, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +9 or monk level 5th.
data.description: Your mastery of the unpredictable power of flames allows you to unleash scorching strikes that burn your enemies even when you fail to make contact.
data.benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempt per day. While using this style and Elemental Fist to deal fire damage, you gain a bonus on fire damage rolls equal to your Wisdom bonus. Further, if your Elemental Fist melee attack misses while you are using it to deal fire damage, you still deal 1d6 points of fire damage to your target.

data.name: Efreeti Touch
data.prerequisites: Con 15, Wis 17, Efreeti Style, Efreeti Stance, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +13 or monk level 11th.
data.description: Your knowledge of the secrets of the burning wind and blazing sun allows you to collect flames into your hands and unleash them in a gout of elemental fire.
data.benefit: While using Efreeti Style, as a standard action, you can spend two Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempts to unleash a 15-foot coneshaped burst of flame. Creatures caught in the cone take your unarmed strike damage plus the fire damage from your Elemental Fist and catch on fire. A successful Ref lex save (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wis modif ier) reduces the damage by half and prevents a target from catching on fire.

data.name: Elusive Redirection
data.prerequisites: Elusive target class feature, Combat Expertise, Improved Unarmed Strike, flowing monk level 12th.
data.description: You can redirect an attack back at your assailant or into an adjacent enemy.
data.benefit: When you successfully use your elusive target class feature to avoid taking damage, you can spend an immediate action and an additional point from your ki pool to redirect that attack back at your attacker or toward any other opponent adjacent to you and your attacker. This attack uses the same attack roll as the original attack, but it targets the opponent you choose.

data.name: Enfilading Fire
data.prerequisites: Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, one other teamwork feat.
data.description: Your ranged attacks take advantage of the flanking maneuvers of allies.
data.benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on ranged attacks made against a foe flanked by 1 or more allies with this feat.

data.name: Escape Route
data.description: You have trained to watch your allies' backs, covering them as they make tactical withdraws.
data.benefit: An ally who also has this feat provokes no attacks of opportunity for moving through squares adjacent to you or within your space.

data.name: Expert Driver
data.prerequisites: Skilled Driver with the selected vehicle type.
data.description: When driving a chosen type of vehicle, you exhibit incredible control, maneuvering the vehicle with greater ease and stopping with uncanny precision.
data.benefit: You can make an accelerate, decelerate, or turn action as a move action instead of a standard action. Furthermore, when stopping a vehicle, you subtract 10 feet from the roll to determine how many feet the vehicle moves forward before it stops.

data.name: Extra Bane
data.prerequisites: Bane class feature.
data.description: You can use your bane ability more often than normal.
data.benefit: You can use your bane ability for 3 additional rounds per day.

data.name: Extra Grit
data.prerequisites: Grit class feature or the Amateur Gunslinger feat.
data.description: You have more grit than the ordinary gunslinger.
data.benefit: You gain 2 extra grit points at the start of each day, and your maximum grit increases by 2.
data.normal: If you are a gunslinger, you gain your Wisdom modifier in grit points at the start of each day, which is also your maximum grit. If you have the Amateur Gunslinger feat, you gain 1 grit point at the start of each day, and your maximum grit is equal to your Wisdom modifier.
data.special: If you possess levels in the gunslinger class, you can take this feat multiple times.

data.name: False Opening
data.prerequisites: Dex 13, Dodge, Close Quarters Thrower or Point-Blank Master, Weapon Focus with selected ranged weapon.
data.description: When you make a ranged attack while threatened, you can fool your opponent into thinking he has an opening.
data.benefit: Choose a ranged weapon or a thrown weapon. When you make a ranged attack using that weapon, you can choose to provoke an attack of opportunity from one or more opponents who threaten you. You gain a +4 dodge bonus against such attacks. An opponent that makes such an attack and misses you loses his Dexterity bonus to AC against you until the end of your turn.

data.name: Feint Partner
data.prerequisites: Bluff 1 rank.
data.description: A little diversion is all you need to slip through your foe's defenses.
data.benefit: Whenever an ally who also has this feat successfully feints an opponent, that opponent also loses his Dexterity bonus to AC against the next attack you make against him before the end of the feinting ally's next turn.

data.name: Felling Escape
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Trip.
data.description: Through the use of fluid contortions and manipulations of leverage, you can throw your opponent to the ground after escaping a grapple.
data.benefit: When you break an opponent's grapple with a combat maneuver check or Escape Artist check, you can spend a swift action to make a trip attempt against that opponent.

data.name: Felling Smash
data.prerequisites: Int 13, Str 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: You commit all your focus to a devastating blow, trying to crush your opponent to the ground.
data.benefit: If you use the attack action to make a single melee attack at your highest base attack bonus while using Power Attack and you hit an opponent, you can spend a swift action to attempt a trip combat maneuver against that opponent.

data.name: Feral Combat Training
data.prerequisites: Improved Unarmed Strike, Weapon Focus with selected natural weapon.
data.description: You were taught a style of martial arts that relies on the natural weapons from your racial ability or class feature.
data.benefit: Choose one of your natural weapons. While using the selected natural weapon, you can apply the effects of feats that have Improved Unarmed Strike as a prerequisite.
data.special: If you are a monk, you can use the selected natural weapon with your flurry of blows class feature.

data.name: Field Repair
data.prerequisites: Craft 4 ranks.
data.description: You can repair your broken weapon or armor to serviceability even without the benefits of artisan tools.
data.benefit: If you are trained in a Craft skill appropriate to a broken item, you can repair that item with no raw material cost and no penalty on your Craft skill check for using improvised tools. If you spend a day, the item regains 1 hit point plus one-quarter of its original hit points. Alternatively, if the item gained the broken condition because it is a firearm that has misf ired or a siege engine that suffered a mishap, or has the broken condition because it has the fragile weapon quality (or some similar quality), you can make a Craft check with the DC it takes to craft that item (see Table 2-2, below). If the check succeeds, the item loses the broken condition.
data.normal: Improvised tools impose a -2 penalty on Craft checks. Items require raw materials to repair.

data.name: Final Embrace
data.prerequisites: Str 13, Int 3; naga, serpentfolk, or creature that has the constrict special attack as a racial ability; base attack bonus +3.
data.description: Your coils are particularly deadly, allowing you to constrict opponents of your size or smaller.
data.benefit: You gain the constrict and grab special attacks. Your constrict attack deals damage equal to your unarmed strike or primary natural weapon melee attack. Further, you can grab and constrict opponents up to your size.
data.normal: You can grab and constrict creatures one size smaller than you.

data.name: Final Embrace Horror
data.prerequisites: Str 15, Int 3; naga, serpentfolk, or creature that has the constrict special attack; Final Embrace; base attack bonus +6.
data.description: Your constricting attack has become stronger and more lethal.
data.benefit: A creature that takes damage from your constrict attack is also shaken until the start of your next turn.

data.name: Final Embrace Master
data.prerequisites: Str 17, Int 3; naga, serpentfolk, or creature that has the constrict special attack; Final Embrace; Final Embrace Horror; base attack bonus +9.
data.description: Few creatures can survive the crushing horror of your Final Embrace.
data.benefit: Double the number of damage dice for your constrict special attack.

data.name: Flanking Foil
data.description: Fighting multiple foes is easy for you.
data.benefit: Whenever you hit an adjacent opponent with a melee attack, until the start of your next turn, that opponent does not gain any flanking bonus on attack rolls while it is f lanking you and cannot deal sneak attack damage to you. It can still provide a flank for its allies.

data.name: Fortified Armor Training
data.prerequisites: Proficient with armor or shield.
data.description: You have learned to let your armor bear the brunt of the worst attacks.
data.benefit: If an opponent scores a critical hit against you, you can turn the critical hit into a normal hit. If you do, either your armor or your shield gains the broken condition (your choice).

data.name: Furious Finish
data.prerequisites: Rage class feature, Vital Strike, base attack bonus +6.
data.description: You channel all of your rage into one massive blow to crush your enemy.
data.benefit: While raging, when you use the Vital Strike feat, you can choose not to roll your damage dice and instead deal damage equal to the maximum roll possible on those damage dice. If you do, your rage immediately ends, and you are fatigued (even if you would not normally be).

data.name: Gory Finish
data.prerequisites: Dazzling Display, Weapon Focus.
data.description: By drawing upon wells of savagery, you can slay your foe in creative and horrifyingly gruesome manners, intimidating nearby foes.
data.benefit: When you use the attack action, you can use a weapon with which you have Weapon Focus to make a single attack at your highest base attack bonus. If you reduce your target to negative hit points, you can spend a swift action to make an Intimidate check to demoralize all foes within 30 feet who could see your attack.

data.name: Greater Channel Smite
data.prerequisites: Channel energy class feature, Channel Smite, base attack bonus +8.
data.description: You empower your weapon with the might of your deity, which you discharge as you strike your foes.
data.benefit: Before making any melee attacks on your turn, you can use a swift action to expend one daily use of your channel energy class feature. The dice from your channel energy feature form a pool of damage dice you can access to further damage creatures normally harmed by the energy you are channeling-undead for positive energy, living creatures for negative energy. Prior to making each melee attack, allocate dice from the pool to be used as extra damage dice if you hit. Your target can make a Will save, as normal, to halve this extra damage. This extra damage is not multiplied when you score a critical hit. If you miss, the extra damage dice remain in your pool, but any dice left unexpended at the end of your turn are wasted.

data.name: Greater Rending Fury
data.prerequisites: Improved Rending Fury, Rending Fury, base attack bonus +12, rend special attack.
data.description: When your claws latch on to an opponent, the effect is bloody and horrific.
data.benefit: Whenever you rend an opponent, you deal 1d6 bleed damage to that opponent. This is an addition to the effects of the rend.

data.name: Greater Snap Shot
data.prerequisites: Dex 17, Improved Snap Shot, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Snap Shot, base attack bonus +12.
data.description: You can prey on any gap in your foe's guard with impunity, and with even greater range.
data.benefit: Whenever you make an attack of opportunity using a ranged weapon and hit, you gain a +2 bonus on the damage roll and a +2 bonus on rolls to confirm a critical hit with that attack. These bonuses increase to +4 when you have base attack bonus +16, and to +6 when you have base attack bonus +20.

data.name: Greater Whip Mastery
data.prerequisites: Improved Whip Mastery, Weapon Focus (whip), Whip Mastery, base attack bonus +8.
data.description: You can use a whip to make combat maneuvers with ease.
data.benefit: You are so quick with your whip that you never drop it due to a failed disarm or trip combat maneuver attempt. Further, you gain the ability to grapple using your whip. To do so, use the normal grapple rules with the following changes. Attack: You cannot use your whip to attack while you are using it to grapple an opponent. Damage: When dealing damage to your grappled opponent, you deal your whip's weapon damage rather than your unarmed strike damage. Free Hands: You take no penalty on your combat maneuver check for having fewer than two hands free when you use your whip to grapple. Reach: Rather than pulling your grappled opponent adjacent to you when you successfully grapple and when you move the grapple, you must keep him within your whip's reach minus his own reach to maintain the grapple.
